story:
I would like this chance to introduce myself and my home health care agency. My name is Ashley James-Harris. I've been a qualified Personal Support Worker for the past 10 years and I absolutely love devoting my days and nights assisting seniors, people with disabilities, and children with special needs. I've been honoured to work in Group homes, nursing homes, hospitals, and in private house holds across Ontario. 


Having such a high passion to see people get the type of home care and dignity they deserve I decided to create a 5 star home health care agency... SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS.   This being my first year in business has been truly amazing. I have meet some of the most amazing families/people and I'm truly grateful for this opportunity. 



What I have accomplished so far for SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS. 


I used my own personal savings, to register SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS,  purchased business cards, created a beautiful company logo, started a web site (www.simplecaresolutions.net) purchase uniforms, badges, flyers, out door advertisement such as bus stop benches, brochures, added graphics to my car for advertising, and of course all the electronics such as MAC computer, IPAD, a 5 in 1 printer, and a large file cabinet.  


Some of the services SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS will continue to provide our clients with are:


Alzheimer's and dementia support/care

Hospital sitters

Nursing home feeders

Grooming/All hygiene needs

Meal preparation/meal feeding

G tube feeding

Companionship

Outings

Doctors appointments 

Light housekeeping

Catheterizations

Overnight client monitoring

Range of motion exercises

End-of-life care

And so much more.



It has been an incredibly difficult decision for me to allow myself to put my pride aside and ask for help. But its needed, So I decided to launch this campaign. 


In order to expand SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS I have set my goal at $30,000 which I believe is obtainable, however I really need your help. By contributing you will be helping me to take SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS to the next level. Your funding will 1. Help me create more outstanding advertisement across The General Toronto Area to help educate families about this incredible service that's available for them, and #2 Help me with the purchase of a reliable wheel chair assessable van which is extremely necessary for clients that are confined to their power wheelchairs. 


My goal for SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS is as followed 


*A service that offers quality care, affordable rates, and services personalized to meet the needs of each individual client. 


*Build a team of licensed, experienced, caring, Support workers that put the client's needs first. 


*Provide a better quality of life for our clients in the comfort of their own homes. 


*Create jobs in the General Toronto Area for nurses, personal support workers, nannies, and even drivers (outings/appointments)


*Offer CPR, First Aid, and CPI courses for our staff. 



What You Get

Of course we don't expect your contributions to be received without reward.  Here is what you will receive:


$25+ contributors - receive a big thank you and constant communications on our launch and progress. 


$50+ contributors - receive your name listed as a contributor and a sponsor on our website as well as a beautiful SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS pen. 



$100+ contributors - receive your name or company name listed as a contributor and sponsor on all publications and also receive a small banner space to advertise your own venture on our website for 3 months as well as a beautiful SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS pen and a "I SUPPORT SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS" mug or t-shirt. 



Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share. 


A heartfelt thanks to all who support my dream to become Canada's most spectacular, reliable, and honest home health care agency. 


Warmest regards,

Ashley James-Harris.

In order to expand SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS I have set my goal at $30,000 which I believe is obtainable, however I really need your help. By contributing you will be helping me to take SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS to the next level. Your funding will 1. Help me create more outstanding advertisement across The General Toronto Area to help educate families about this incredible service that's available for them, and #2 Help me with the purchase of a reliable wheel chair assessable van which is extremely necessary for clients that are confined to their power wheelchairs. 
My goal for SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS is as followed *A service that offers quality care, affordable rates, and services personalized to meet the needs of each individual client. *Build a team of licensed, experienced, caring, Support workers that put the client's needs first. *Provide a better quality of life for our clients in the comfort of their own homes. *Create jobs in the General Toronto Area for nurses, personal support workers, nannies, and even drivers (outings/appointments)*Offer CPR, First Aid, and CPI courses for our staff. What You GetOf course we don't expect your contributions to be received without reward.  Here is what you will receive:$25+ contributors - receive a big thank you and constant communications on our launch and progress. $50+ contributors - receive your name listed as a contributor and a sponsor on our website as well as a beautiful SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS pen. $100+ contributors - receive your name or company name listed as a contributor and sponsor on all publications and also receive a small banner space to advertise your own venture on our website for 3 months as well as a beautiful SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS pen and a "I SUPPORT SIMPLE CARE SOLUTIONS" mug or t-shirt. Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.Remember to use the Indiegogo share. A heartfelt thanks to all who support my dream to become Canada's most spectacular, reliable, and honest home health care agency. Warmest regards,Ashley James-Harris.

story:
Taste of Cajeta (Pronounced ca-hay-ta)

Over the years, I've learned many recipes from many cultures. To reproduce most on a commercial basis, it's very expensive and often quite competitive. One thing I learned how to make many years ago is the traditional Mexican Cajeta, an "over-the-top", caramel sauce made with goat milk.

There are very few Cajeta makers in the US. It's a most time-consuming process as the milk/sugar combination must be cooked for about 4 hours, and it's best made with the raw goat milk, something not readily available in most back yards.

Living in SW Utah, we are surrounded by a Latino population, who currently are limited to purchasing one flavor of Cajeta at Walmart. They tell me it's just not the real thing. Several have been taste testing for us and are very anxious to purchase our product.

Of course, our "gringo" friends are also hooked on the sweet stuff and are asking to purchase it.


The nitty-gritty details.

We are funding this project through various methods. We are putting in money from our market sales. That includes money from the sale of our lambs, Certified Organic produce, and live goats (for pets, breeders, and meat).

We are here at Indigogo doing "step funding". This project is to help us with getting the licensing so we can produce and sell the product. Because we are using raw goat milk, our product must undergo some special testing, including an AW test. The purpose of that test is to determine the water activity. If we can keep the AW >.85, then the Cajeta will be considered "shelf stable".

For this second phase (the first was to perfect the recipe and the process, self-funded),  we are seeking funds to purchase proper testing equipment, and to pay for the cost of sending samples to Utah State University where the Cajeta will be tested, and to pay for the actual cost of testing and the cost of the annual product licesnse.

To be precise, and consistent with the Cajeta, we need to purchase a couple of Brix meters for high sugar content. Yes, there's a big fat name for them. Each one costs about $85. The reason we need to is that they fall out of calibration, and we want to have one in good working order at all times.

The cost of preparing and sending appropriate samples to from Beryl, UT to Logan, UT is approximately $60.

The cost of testing could be as high as $800, depending upon how many different tests must be performed.

Creating and printing our inital lalels is expected to cost about $300.

Additional funding is to purchase ingredients including cane sugar, Mexican Vanilla, and Cinnamon, and jars w/lids and rings.

When you help us with this, you get jars of our product, invitations to visit the farm, the opportunity to personalize our commercial kitchen, or to have a variation of the Tradtitional Cajeta named for you (after you come and help us invent it).

Now,should we be so unfortunate as to not reach our goal, we'll use the funds first for the refractometers, then for sending the samples to Utah State, then to help pay for testing and labels.  We continue to add our own personal capital to the project as well as a portion of the gross profits from our other farm operations.

The Impact

We are working hard to create a wonderful product which has been a part of the Latino community for hundreds of years. This is a product that few people can make at home. Sure, they can easily make the dulce de leche, which is made from cow's milk, but it's not as complex, satisfying, and fun to eat.
 
We know from market surveys that the demand is much higher than the supply. Fellow Cajeta makers around the US tell me they can't make enough to satisfy their local markets.

Other Ways You Can Help

In the event you are unable to assist us with money, you may still help us a lot by telling your friends about us. Communicate with us.  We'll find a way to help you help us, even if it means sending a sample to you.
 
Indegogo makes it very easy to share on Twitter and Facebook, or to send a personal e-mail to a couple of friends. We appreciate your help, and Indegogo is helping both of us with their incredible platform.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The weather is about to take a turn for the worse, but that's no reason to stick your bike in storage! What if you could come out of the winter not only with your fitness and sanity in tact, but as a better rider as well? 

How is this possible you say? If you haven't already ridden an indoor bike park, do yourself a favor and get to the nearest one and prepare for the ride of your life! 

The Wheel Mill is Pittsburgh's first indoor bike park, and we opened to the public this April. We are housed inside a building the size of an entire city block, 80,000sf, with two floors of riding. We have mountain bike and BMX trails, jumps, ramps, etc, for all ages and skill levels. We still have more to build though, and a pump track is one of the most universally ride-able features out there. But let's back up a minute and tell you a little about ourselves.

Who is The Wheel Mill? The Wheel Mill is owned by me, Harry Geyer, and my wife Sheila. My father loves bikes and took me on my first bike tour when I was 5 years old in Germany. We went 17 kilometers around town. I was hooked. Since then I've raced BMX, road, and mountain bikes, but mostly I just mess around for fun or commute. I love riding our local single track, and the BMX crew here is teaching me how to jump (Heck yeah!).

Who built The Wheel Mill? Lot's of people, but the bulk of the credit goes to Mike and Mark Potoczny. They designed the now famous "Woods Jump Room" and the flowy "Park Room". We were also fortunate to have the legendary  Burly Matt Gibeaut help with the odd angles and bowl corners. Honorable mentions must go out to Josh Pekich,Tom Arkus, Brian Yeagle, Ryan Popple, and Jay Scott for their vision and hammer swinging. I also enlisted carpenters from my construction company to help keep things moving. That far from covers everyone, but you'll have to wait for the acceptance speech for the rest of the names, haha. 


If you want to see what it takes to build a room full of ramps then check out this time lapse of the Woods Jump Room:

So, what's a Pump Track? A pump track is a course made up of a series of rollers and berms. When a pump track is properly designed, no pedaling is required to propel you and your bike forward. With a pumping motion you create all of the speed you need.


Who can use a Pump Track? Anyone! That's the beauty of it. You can do it on a road bike, full suspension mountain bike, or a BMX bike, anything. What matters is that we build it right and you learn how to pump. Your wheels never need to leave the ground, but as your skill level increases you can get more creative with the lines and even turn the rollers into jumps!


How will the money be used? Our biggest single expense in building a pump track is materials. We will use approximately $9000 in plywood, studs, and hardware. Our next biggest expense is labor. We are setting aside $7000 to pay the best builders around to turn our concept into reality. The last expense is for our Scholarship Program. We need to pay the instructors and cover the additional insurance costs for running extra camps, and we are setting aside $2000 for that.


What is the Scholarship Program? This past summer we partnered with some local non-profit organizations and provided summer camps to kids that otherwise wouldn't have been able to attend. The kids loved it, we loved it, and you'd be amazed at how quickly their skills improved with some intensive instruction. With your help, we can continue to provide free camps to local children and spread the joy!


Thank You! Without your support there would be no bike park, and we want to reward you with some huge discounts on season passes for all ages, as well as some other gifts you won't be able to find anywhere else. Remember, these passes are only available through indiegogo and quantities are limited. We want to reach our goal and get back to building as soon as possible! See you at The Wheel Mill!

Risks and challenges

Like every other feature in the park, we are going for something more with our pump track, and that means getting out of the comfort zone, out of the tried and true. When you explore new territory, you take all of your knowledge and experience and apply it to an idea or concept that is untested up to that point. 
The goal of building this pump track isn't to make it look exactly like the drawing, the goal is to make it the best riding pump track out there, and that may mean some tweaking along the way. 
This is the same process that has worked so well for every other room we have built. Take experienced riders with creative ideas, account for the constraints of the physical space, put that into a plan, get experienced builders to make it real, test it as you go, tweak it until its right, and there you have it! 
One of our biggest challenges is incorporating the BMX start gate and sprint lane into the first leg of the course. The second biggest challenge is making a turnaround that allows you to do multiple, uninterrupted laps. These areas may need to be built and rebuilt in order to get them right. The same could be said for any part of the track, really. In the end, you'll be riding on the best track that could be built in the space!

story:
People involved in the sex trade are vulnerable to violence. Sex workers, even more than others, are blamed when raped, murdered, assaulted, or harassed. And sex workers face added barriers to reporting, from elevated shaming and victim-blaming to criminal charges for prostitution.

December 17th, International Day to End Violence Against Sex Workers,  was created to call attention to crimes committed against sex workers all over the globe, and collectively demand protection, respect, and accountability.

On December 17, sex workers and allies stage protests, memorials, marches and vigils. They gather to raise awareness about systematic, widespread, often ignored violence against sex workers, as well as related systematic violence against women of color, undocumented immigrants, trans-women, indigenous women, homeless and low-income women, and other groups at the margins.

Learn More About 12/17 |  History of 12/17 | Event Locations | Organize an Event

This year, Sex Workers Outreach Project is asking you to help us gather funds to...

  1. Aggregate and publish details of International Day to End Violence Against Sex Workers events across the world.
  2. Reach out to North American media about December 17 and how criminalization and discrimination perpetuate violence against our communities.
  3. Cover costs of US-based December 17 events.

We hope you will help us raise awareness about the violence sex workers face and TAKE A STAND.


What We Need & What You Get

This year, Sex Workers Outreach Project wants to ensure chapters can afford space, flyers, and other materials for December 17 events. We also want to have funding available for others trying to organize public events on this day. And we want to have a big media presence. To do this, we need your help.

We are asking you to help us raise $4,500.

$4,500 will fund...

  • Central Coordinator - 70-80 hours of media outreach, web publishing, coordination with and book-keeping for events ($900)
  • Twelve US December 17 Events - Refreshments, promotional materials, space, decor and other supplies for twelve US-Based events that don't have an account and budget($3,600, or appx. $300 per event)

The numbers we give are averages, and different event may cost more, or less. 
  • A group planning outdoor protest may only need $60 for posters, markers, and a loud-speaker. 
  • A group organizing a vigil may need $600 for a venue, flyers, decor and snacks, or only, if a venue or food is donated, only $200. 
We anticipate our funding goal is just enough to fund December 17 events, as well as support promotion nationally. Should we raise extra funds, they will be be used to support December 17 events we didn't budget to fund, or saved for 2015 December 17 events. 


The Impact

December 17 is an important day for individuals involved in the sex trade, activists and allies. This year, a number of high-profile murders have brought systematic violence against individuals involved in the sex trade to mainstream media, reminding us as a community the extent of violence we face. Additionally, the closure of My Redbook, the passage of PROP 36 in Canada, and a myriad of new laws that hurt sex workers reminded us of how widespread targetting of our community is. This year, it's important to come together as a community, and stand up against violence.

 Funding will:

  • Support a coordinated, nation-wide effort to raise awareness of the harmful impact of discrimination, criminalization, and stigma on sex workers.
  • Ensure impacted populations can hold events.
  • Ensure nation-wide media attention to December 17 and issues most important to sex workers.
As a national advocacy organization, SWOP-USA has been supporting December 17 events for over 10 years. We have national reach and connections to spread the word about funding available and provide support to event organizers.


Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount you give will help make nation-wide events on International Day to End Violence Against Sex Workers possible. 

Even if you can't contribute, you can support the goals of December 17th by: 

  • Emailing your friends, family and colleagues, and asking them to give.
  • Donating a Perk for our campaign!
  • Sharing the campaign via social media.
  • Organizing a December 17 event in your city.
  • Reaching out to your local SWOP Chapter and offering space, flyer-design, snacks, free printing, or general man-power to support their event. 
  • Writing a blog, editorial, or article about December 17 and the multiple forms of violence individuals involved in the sex trade face.

story:
Click Here !











Can iBreathe analyze the air quality?

iBreathe can not analyzing the air quality, we have remove feature of "air monitoring" to make air purifying function more efficient, safe and powerful.

Does it work indoor and outdoor ?

Yes it can purify the air indoor up to 20 m radius and outdoor up to 8 m radius.

Is the iBreathe safe and effective to use on an airplane?

yes it's safe and highly efficient during flights.

How long does the battery lasts ?

If fully charged iBreathe can last up to 8 hours.

Does it works for peoples that have pollen allergy ?

Yes it neutralizes pollen particles in the air letting your breathe clean and fresh air anytime.

How fast does it purify the air? When you turn the iBreathe on is it instant?

It can decrease significantly amount of air born disease or viruses, bacteria, smoke etc approximately within 10 to 20 seconds. Battery level wont indicate the efficiency of the device.

Can the iBreathe work with the USB charging cable plugged in always (so it would even be working if the battery died completely in the future years down the road)?

Yes iBreathe works even when it is charging  and also accumulates battery letting you charge and use the device instantly .

I was wondering will the ibreathe work in my pocket or do I have to wear it outside my clothing?

Unfortunately while in pocket it is less efficient since iBreathe distributes negative ions to neutralize the air pollution.

What is the ionizer module ions/cc capacity?

Ionizer module used in iBreathe has an Ion output of min. 4.000.000 ions/cc .

Can you provide us with some of the studies are you referencing for it’s health benefits?

In the link below you can find studies done with similar ionizer module that will be used in iBreathe too .

http://www.murata.com/en-global/products/ionissimo/ionizer/effect

Does the iBreathe produce dangerous levels of ozone?

No. iBreathe produces NO measurable amount of ozone.

Feel free to ask any question we will answer shortly and post it in our F.A.Q


Some of the contributions are coming also from offline contributors that supported our idea to come together and make this happen !

Yes iBreathe works even when it is charging  and also accumulates battery letting you charge and use the device instantly .

I was wondering will the ibreathe work in my pocket or do I have to wear it outside my clothing?
Unfortunately while in pocket it is less efficient since iBreathe distributes negative ions to neutralize the air pollution.
What is the ionizer module ions/cc capacity?
Ionizer module used in iBreathe has an Ion output of min. 4.000.000 ions/cc .
Can you provide us with some of the studies are you referencing for it’s health benefits?


In the link below you can find studies done with similar ionizer module that will be used in iBreathe too .
http://www.murata.com/en-global/products/ionissimo/ionizer/effect

Does the iBreathe produce dangerous levels of ozone?
No. iBreathe produces NO measurable amount of ozone.

Feel free to ask any question we will answer shortly and post it in our F.A.QSome of the contributions are coming also from offline contributors that supported our idea to come together and make this happen !

story:
IN THE BEGINNING 

Ever since I became an instructor in 2012 and first learnt of the annual ZUMBA Convention in Orlando, Florida - I wanted so badly to go there. I wanted the atmosphere, the learning, the experience - the whole dang package. The only problem was that Orlando was awfully far away and so a 4 day event at that distance quickly became too expensive to allow. Fun to dream but I was more than happy getting my specialty trainings close to home in the Toronto area. Trainings and events are extremely common in that area so they wouldn't be hard to come by. Little did I know that only a year after getting my ZIN licence that I would move to PEI. Beautiful, breezy PEI with its picturesque landscapes, abundant seafood and next to no ZUMBA events or trainings! Just my luck!!? K.

 ~

Depuis que je fais de la ZUMBA, j'entends parler de la Convention à Orlando et j'avais l'impression que c'était inaccessible pour une simple mortelle addictée  de Zumba. Puis, j'ai obtenu ma certification B1 et mon B2. Par la suite, j'ai commencé tranquillement à enseigner. J'avais de plus en plus envie de me rendre à Orlando et cette année, j'ai rencontré mon âme sœur de ZUMBA, Kathleen et nous tentons désormais d'aller s'enrichir à la Convention! J.  

THE PROBLEM

Just before leaving Ontario, I got to my first specialty training of ZUMBA Toning. This class has changed everything I thought about ZUMBA, reintroduced me to working out with weights and I have been able to bring my love for this class style to so many here on the island. The problem? There is a drastic need for more inspiring, motivating and exhilarating fitness classes here in Summerside and Western PEI and the training does not exist here to facilitate it. The closest training would be a minimum of 4-6 hours away - making a $250 full day training seminar into a 3 day, two nights stay long weekend due to distance. (After 8 hours or more of ZUMBA for the training driving home for 4 hours isn't really a safe option!)  K.

~ 

Lisez seulement ci-dessus! ;) J.

WHAT CHANGED IT ALL

I met Justine. My fellow ZUMBA instructor had all the same problems I did. We love teaching, sharing our love of fitness and health and want to continue to share our knowledge and enthusiasm for ZUMBA. How can we advance our education and training to share with all our students with such difficult access to specialty training? K.

~ 

Juste  laisse-moi penser Kathleen et la solution suit! J.



"LA" BEST SOLUTION OF ALL

ZUMBA CONVENTION 2015 Orlando, Florida. This one event, solves all our problems. This 5 day event brings together world renowned ZUMBA EDUCATION SPECIALISTS (ZESs) to teach and share their knowledge of health, fitness, ZUMBA and general fitness class techniques to best teach our students!

What does this event include?

2 Specialty Trainings (yes, TWO! So we aren't wasting any time here!)*

4 ZIN Jam Sessions and Specialty Rhythm Sessions

a ZUMBA Fitness Concert Event

a ZUMBA theme party

Training Workshops and Practical & Skill Application Courses

Going to this event means that we would get all our education necessary to continue our fitness journey and to help others in theirs for the next few years!

*Note: This means I will be able teach ZUMBA Step classes and ZUMBA Gold. Justine will also be able to teach ZUMBA Step and ZUMBA Kids. Click on the classes, to learn more about them!

What is even better is since we would be traveling together, there are a few cost saving things we can do! So let's get into it - what would a trip like this cost?

ZUMBA CONVENTION 2015 - $450 

Flight Round Trip from Charlottetown, PEI to Orlando, Florida - $600

Hotel at Convention for 5 nights (shared with 3 other people) - $250

= TOTAL of $1300 per person 

NOTE: One SPECIALTY TRAINING is $250, so the Convention cost is a fabulous deal. We get TWO trainings and then a whole whack more!

ALSO NOTE:This doesn't include food costs, travel to and from airport etc.

Justine and I are extremely excited about this opportunity to expand our knowledge and training as well as to bring all this back to PEI and share with our fellow islanders. All we ask is that if you can support our trip to help lessen these large fees! You can support by directly donating to our trip or simply by sharing our story with your friends and family on FACEBOOK, any other social media platform or email! We are grateful for all the help and support we have gotten already from our friends, family and students. We cannot ask for a better support group from you all. 

Here is a little video about our event held on June 14th 2015 to also raise some money for this trip!

story:
My name is Luciana Lim. I'm creating this fundraising for my little cousin Antonio Chandra, who is in Indonesia.

Antonio Chandra is 8 years old. He is diagnosed with medulloblastoma. Medulloblastoma is a malignant or cancerous brain tumor that arises from the cerebellum, the part of the brain that controls balance, coordination and other complex functions. Medulloblastoma is a member of a larger group of tumors called Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor (PNET). All PNETs, including medulloblastoma, have the ability to spread, or disseminate, throughout the entire central nervous system. Most medulloblastoma can be cured with aggressive surgery, cranial spinal radiation, and chemotherapy. 

Antonio had had the surgery and required to get chemotherapy and radiation but his family is going through financial difficulties to save his life. His family does not has any health insurance and they live in a small city in West Borneo, Indonesia, which does not have advanced medical equipment to treat him. He has to go to the capital city Jakarta, to get the treatments he needs. 

His parents need assistance with the expensive medical treatments. I hope we can help relieve some this financial burden so their child can have the medical care he needs and be cancer-free. Can you help us in raising money to save Antonio's life and to help his parents focus on caring for their child rather than how they will pay for the medical bill? All proceeds raised will go to help pay fo Antonio's care.

No donation is too small. Every Dollar counts. Please donate and help with what you can. If you can not contribute, it's OK. You can help Antonio by sharing and forwarding this to everyone you know on twitter, messenger, facebook, etc. Also, please pray for Antonio and his family. 

Thank you for all the prayers, love, support, and generosity everybody has shown in coming together to help save Antonio's life. God bless!

story:
*MARLIE IS 7 MONTHS INTO HER BATTLE WITH CANCER.  DOCTORS ADVISE SHE WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 2 MORE YEARS FIGHTING.  WE NEED ALL THE HELP WE CAN GET.  WE VERY MUCH APPRECIATE ALL DONATIONS BIG OR SMALL.  EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!*

This is the story of Marlie Dowe D’Andrade, the 2 year old daughter of Shelley and Sean and her battle with leukemia. The following is an account of some of the many challenges Marlie and her family face daily, as related by her mother:

To give a very slight glimpse into what life has been for the past 8 months:
Twice, we have been in the ICU with Marlie close to death. The first time was when she was diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL). The day she was diagnosed she received chemo in her spinal fluid, a bone marrow test, lumbar puncture, hemoglobin, platelet transfusions and had surgery to put a pick line in her chest. This was followed by 3 days of steroids in the Intensive Care Unit and then a course of chemo. She contracted mouth sores as a side effect from the chemo and had severe damage to her skin on her chest from a reaction to the dressings over her pick line. Due to her mouth sores, the need for transfusions, infections and fevers, we ended up living in the hospital for 40 days.
After this first stay we were home for about a week and then back in the hospital for another 10 days while Marlie received her next phase of chemo. Then we had another break for a few weeks before going to the Oncology Clinic weekly. During one of our visits, her pick line was accessed and when they flushed the line it brought bacteria directly into her heart and blood stream. Within an hour Marlie went from a happy playful child to a little girl in the emergency room, septic, close to death, with numerous doctors and nurses working to stabilize her. She had emergency surgery to remove the pick line and replace it with a port. We ended up staying in the hospital for 2 weeks while Marlie fought the infection and started the next phase of chemo. This phase included 2 weekly sedations, lumbar punctures with chemo injected into her nervous system for 3 weeks.
Life with a child with ALL is very hard, we are constantly monitoring her temperature because a fever could mean an infection, and when her counts are down, it can be fatal. There is also a chance that due to her weekly leg needles she receives she could get a blood clot (30% of children do), and because of the different meds she is on, her bones could also lose density and be more prone to damage. When her counts are low and she is neutrapenic, (about 50% of the time), she cannot go out in public, we cannot have visitors unless they are perfectly healthy adults, and it is strongly recommended that no children visit Marlie.
After she receives her weekly leg needles, she is usually lethargic, whiny, clingy and generally feeling awful for a few days. Every third week she receives a list of chemo through her port line. This chemo makes her feel sick, and gives her extremely painful mouth sores. Our little girl can hardly eat for a week and ends up on morphine to control her pain. Every time Doctors access her port there is the fear that she will go septic again due to bacteria being forced back into her blood stream.
During the weeks when our daughter receives chemo and goes on steroids, life is even more difficult. She is in constant pain for a week to 10 days, crying, saying it hurts, whining, clinging, lethargic, and is awake all day and night.
Another side effect from her chemo, she has issues with her legs. She has pain, pins and needles and cannot lift her left foot properly when walking. When her legs are bothering her, she can’t tell us exactly what the issue is (because of her age) or where it hurts but she will grab her leg and start crying. She will be fine for a few days, and then all of a sudden, she will be limping and holding her leg or her leg will collapse.
Marlie is an incredible little girl. Even at her worse, she tries very hard to play and be engaged in daily life. When we were first in the hospital, her legs were very weak from not walking and from chemo. Even though she was very weak and tired, we would go for daily walks around the hospital with her pushing a baby walker. She became very well known throughout the ward because she would wave and talk to all of the other kids as we passed their rooms.
At the clinic, she is known for trying food from all of the other kids, hugging, and being involved in any games going on. She loves to collect her bravery beads and accosts the Child Life Worker as soon as she sees her to get her most recent beads. She loves dancing, being chased, and even when she is feeling awful, she wants to be taken to the park to swing. She insists on being "in charge" of the adults when we are playing games and makes sure everyone gets involved and has a turn. Marlie's positive energy helps us get through some very difficult days. Her humor and giggles are contagious, and her snuggles and hugs are the most heartwarming thing in our day.
Marlie continues treatment, one day at a time, at home with her parents and at McMaster’s Children’s Hospital in Hamilton, Ontario Canada.

Please help us take the financial stress away while Marlie’s family work on getting their little girl better.
Every little bit counts, if you cannot donate, please help us spread the word of Marlie’s charity by emailing or posting our link online:  http://igg.me/p/239490?a=1412931

story:
Short Summary

Our mission:

One of Choose Rain’s core missions is to provide velvety sweet rainwater and rainwater based products to global residents, businesses and visitors.  By offering a truly healthy and environmentally safe bottled rainwater drink, we will change the current guilt-ridden bottled water experience by making drinking bottled water on the go a “feel good” experience.  Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program will make a difference by offering our healthy, low-calorie alternative rainwater drink as a substitute for the high calorie drinks thrust upon our children by society.  Remove the sugar and make drinks healthy.  Education by example will be the key to change.  We hope others will follow our lead. 

How we do what we do:

We capture pure rainwater, in Ormond Beach, FL and Freeport, Bahamas as it falls from the sky before it hits the ground and becomes contaminated (Saving the aquifer).  Most bottled water companies spend millions of dollars removing the contaminants in a usually unsuccessful attempt to make it like rainwater again.  We throw away the first rainfall containing the dust and pollen.  We micro-filter the sweet rainwater and use ozone, ultraviolet light and magnetics before bottling it in our biodegradable and recyclable bottle that degrades in a landfill in three to five years instead of 500 to 1,000 years (Saving our landfills).  Using ozone, ultraviolet light and magnetics eliminates the need for chlorine and is better for you than the competing waters (Saving your health).  We add nothing to it!  We will have a worldwide impact.  Plans are already underway to build a global capture and distribution network to change the world one child at a time (Saving our children).

Our Team;

• Larry Curran, Founder and CEO - Environmentalist, CPA, MBA, Entrepreneur. I live in a rainwater home where I do not have any other water source.

• Debbie Berner, Director of Marketing  - Owned Marketing Firm – Community Leader

• Jimmy Little, Director of Operations  - Engineering, Testing and Quality Control

• Jim Hartwick, Director of Retail Sales West Coast  - 16 years selling Pepsi, Crystal Geyser & Gatorade

• Mike Wood, Director of Retail Sales East Coast  - 26 years selling Gatorade, Quaker and others

• Kingfiller Bottling – Building our Custom Bottle Plant - Proprietary Patented Processes Save Energy and make our water the best on the market.

What We Need & What You Get

Our rewards include a combination of our rainwater from the clouds priced well below retail and several other perks.  The ultimate package at $10,000 includes Four Hundred Cases (9,600 bottles) of Choose Rain Delivered to a school, Ten Choose Rain limited edition T-Shirts, your child or grandchild on our web-site, a signed plaque commemorating your support and a posting on the Choose Rain web site for all to see.  Other rewards depend on the amount pledged.

We want to raise $50,000 or more by pre-selling our rainwater production to provide our healthy bottled water alternative to schools. We would love for this campaign to exceed 1,000,000 bottles donated to our schools.  Educate our children about their health, about our dwindling global water supply and the problems with plastic in landfills, then they will grow up caring and will pass it on to their children. 

The Impact

Respect Mother Earth - Choose Rain.

Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program is an integral part of spreading our message about saving our precious aquifer, saving our landfills and saving your own health!  We provide rainwater bottled in biodegradable bottles without chlorine and naturally flavored rainwater fruit drinks with Stevia, no sugar, FREE to schools.

You will be part of the ground floor of a great “feel good” product launch meant to change the way we quench our thirst!

What is Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program?

Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program is a project created by Choose Rain LLC.  Choose Rain LLC is building a facility in Ormond Beach, FL to capture rainwater from the sky, process it in a healthy manner without using chlorine and bottle it in a biodegradable and recyclable bottle.  A second rainwater bottling facility is being built in Freeport Bahamas.  We will be making our healthy bottled rainwater available to private individuals and businesses who wish to support our charitable initiative which is to provide pure fresh drinking water to school children.  Just recently, the Bahamian Prime Minister addressed the United Nations assembly and stated that 68 percent of Bahamians are suffering from chronic non-communicable diseases which include diabetes and hypertension and both of these diseases are associated with obesity.  Want to promote an Eco-friendly mission and provide a “Feel Good” product to curb the tide towards obesity and diabetes in the Bahamas and in the USA?   

The Problem: Sugary Drinks Are a Major Contributor to the Obesity Epidemic.

According to the Harvard School of Health, “two out of three adults and one out of three children in the United States are overweight or obese, and the nation spends an estimated $190 billion a year treating obesity-related health conditions. Rising consumption of sugary drinks has been a major contributor to the obesity epidemic. A typical 20-ounce soda contains 15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar and upwards of 240 calories. A 64-ounce fountain cola drink could have up to 700 calories. People who drink this “liquid candy” do not feel as full as if they had eaten the same calories from solid food and do not compensate by eating less.”

Sweet, sugary drinks contribute to this problem of childhood and adult obesity.  If we educate the children to drink fresh, zero calorie rainwater bottled without chlorine in our eco-friendly, biodegradable bottle, they will have a chance to reverse this trend.  Our rainwater based, naturally flavored fruit drinks sweetened with Stevia can replace the sugary drinks currently consumed at home and in schools by children and their parents.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about replacing sugary drinks with our healthy rainwater drink alternatives.

Respect Mother Earth - Choose Rain.  Rain Supports All Life As We Know It!

• Kingfiller Bottling – Building our Custom Bottle Plant - Proprietary Patented Processes Save Energy and make our water the best on the market.


What We Need & What You Get
Our rewards include a combination of our rainwater from the clouds priced well below retail and several other perks.  The ultimate package at $10,000 includes Four Hundred Cases (9,600 bottles) of Choose Rain Delivered to a school, Ten Choose Rain limited edition T-Shirts, your child or grandchild on our web-site, a signed plaque commemorating your support and a posting on the Choose Rain web site for all to see.  Other rewards depend on the amount pledged.
We want to raise $50,000 or more by pre-selling our rainwater production to provide our healthy bottled water alternative to schools. We would love for this campaign to exceed 1,000,000 bottles donated to our schools.  Educate our children about their health, about our dwindling global water supply and the problems with plastic in landfills, then they will grow up caring and will pass it on to their children. 


The Impact
Respect Mother Earth - Choose Rain.
Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program is an integral part of spreading our message about saving our precious aquifer, saving our landfills and saving your own health!  We provide rainwater bottled in biodegradable bottles without chlorine and naturally flavored rainwater fruit drinks with Stevia, no sugar, FREE to schools.
You will be part of the ground floor of a great “feel good” product launch meant to change the way we quench our thirst!
What is Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program?
Choose Rain’s Healthy Drink Awareness Program is a project created by Choose Rain LLC.  Choose Rain LLC is building a facility in Ormond Beach, FL to capture rainwater from the sky, process it in a healthy manner without using chlorine and bottle it in a biodegradable and recyclable bottle.  A second rainwater bottling facility is being built in Freeport Bahamas.  We will be making our healthy bottled rainwater available to private individuals and businesses who wish to support our charitable initiative which is to provide pure fresh drinking water to school children.  Just recently, the Bahamian Prime Minister addressed the United Nations assembly and stated that 68 percent of Bahamians are suffering from chronic non-communicable diseases which include diabetes and hypertension and both of these diseases are associated with obesity.  Want to promote an Eco-friendly mission and provide a “Feel Good” product to curb the tide towards obesity and diabetes in the Bahamas and in the USA?   
The Problem: Sugary Drinks Are a Major Contributor to the Obesity Epidemic.
According to the Harvard School of Health, “two out of three adults and one out of three children in the United States are overweight or obese, and the nation spends an estimated $190 billion a year treating obesity-related health conditions. Rising consumption of sugary drinks has been a major contributor to the obesity epidemic. A typical 20-ounce soda contains 15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar and upwards of 240 calories. A 64-ounce fountain cola drink could have up to 700 calories. People who drink this “liquid candy” do not feel as full as if they had eaten the same calories from solid food and do not compensate by eating less.”
Sweet, sugary drinks contribute to this problem of childhood and adult obesity.  If we educate the children to drink fresh, zero calorie rainwater bottled without chlorine in our eco-friendly, biodegradable bottle, they will have a chance to reverse this trend.  Our rainwater based, naturally flavored fruit drinks sweetened with Stevia can replace the sugary drinks currently consumed at home and in schools by children and their parents.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about replacing sugary drinks with our healthy rainwater drink alternatives.
Respect Mother Earth - Choose Rain.  Rain Supports All Life As We Know It!

story:
Mary was diagnosed with Stage 3 squamous cell carcinoma (tongue cancer) in July of 2009. As a non-smoker her entire life, this came as quite a shock. She had half of her tongue removed and remade from from a skin graft in her arm.

A month after her surgery, she began six weeks of daily radiation treatments and chemotherapy. She lost sixty-five pounds but managed to keep most of her hair, which she considered a fair trade-off. Unfortunately, the radiation also took a heavy toll on her mouth, killing most of her salivary glands. Without the use of saliva, a person's teeth tend to go bad in less than a year and this is what's happened to Mary.

Her surgeon and her dentist both told her that dentures and implants are they only way to fix this problem.

So far, she's had her teeth removed and undergone fifty (50) hours of hyperbaric treatment at Virgina Mason Center For Hyperbaric Medicine.

♦ The first step was the extraction.
♦ Healing from that will take four - five months.
♦ Then the posts for the implants will be placed in her lower jaw.
♦ Healing from that will take another five months, but a prosthetic upper denture (for appearance sake only) can be made to fit.
♦ Then a piece will be made to fit her posts.
♦ Finally, an upper denture will be made for her upper plate.

TA-DA! New Teeth!

The State of Washington has covered the extraction, but not the dentures OR the implants. This is why we're trying to raise $60,000, in three different fundraisers.

Without the help of her community, her friends and her generous online friends, none of this would have even been possible. Thank you so much to everyone who has donated their time and money so far.

QUESTIONS? EMAIL: mmosheskie - at - gmail.com

story:
1GumADay Energy-Boosting Chewing Gum With Tonnes of Health Benefits Launches

Introducing 1GumADay – the brand new energy gum that’s set to offer a boost to all of those juggling increasingly busy lifestyles while wanting to remain fit and healthy.

The innovative new chewing gum is sugar-free and works to improve overall health and wellbeing on a multitude of levels. 


With a minty refreshing flavour and the ability to deliver results twice as fast as energy drinks, but without the nasty added chemicals, 1GumADay is sure to become an invaluable addition to many busy individuals’ daily routines.



The gum is made up of three key ingredients that stimulate and revive the senses: caffeine, guarana and taurine. Caffeine is obviously the ingredient that gives coffee drinkers a little extra vim and verve, while guarana is a plant in the maple family that’s also associated with boosting energy. 

Testers :

Seko23

LivePaola9




Taurine is an organic compound often found in energy drinks and thought to have antoxidant properties. With these three ingredients working in tandem, 1GumADay can offer a dramatic energy boost – both physically and mentally.


1GumADay is totally sugar-free, which means it’s safe to chew all day long. Chewing gum can also stimulate saliva, which not only reduces tooth decay, but also restores the pH balance within the mouth, for a healthier and cleaner sensation.


The gum can also prevent busy individuals from soaking up too many calories as they go about their day. The simple act of chewing gum signals to the brain that you’re about to eat, which triggers a release of insulin. This insulin soaks up the sugars in the bloodstream and prepares them to be used as energy, which could result in preferable metabolic reactions throughout the body. Those chewing 1GumADay will benefit from increased oxygen being pumped to the brain, which also results in higher concentration and improved focus.

story:
Hi! My name is Meaghan Kelly, and I appreciate your time in reading my story, and in helping to support my campaign.

In the fall of 2011, my dad and I ran our first half marathon in Philadelphia. A few short months later, he was diagnosed with kidney cancer. In the months that followed, he had surgery to remove the massive tumor and went to follow up appointments. His recovery went very smoothly, and he was able to run again by the summer of 2012. By early 2013, we had planned to train for our second half marathon in the fall.

However, when he went to a follow-up appointment in April, the doctors found that the cancer had come back in full force. My whole family was devastated by the news. As my dad got progressively worse, I came to accept not only that we wouldn't run the half marathon together in September, but we would never run a half marathon together again.

However, as I continued to run throughout the spring and summer, I realized that I could run a half marathon for each of us. That led me to sign up for the Philadelphia Marathon this November. I will run 13.1 miles for me, and 13.1 miles for my dad.

Now, after countless hospital visits, multiple types of treatments, and a summer filled with stress, anxiety and a glimmer of hope, I honestly feel like I have witnessed a miracle as my dad’s body is finally beginning to fight off the cancer. That miracle is due to the research and the doctors that chose not to give up on him. Because of that, I am fundraising for both the Sloan Kettering Hospital in New York and the Smilow Cancer Center at Yale. The money that I am raising will go directly to funding the research that has been helping my dad, and will continue to do so in the future. 

As I run for my dad, for these two incredible hospitals, and for the fight against kidney cancer, I ask for your support. Even the smallest donation will make a difference, and I would appreciate help in informing people about my campaign via Facebook, Twitter, or email. Please feel free to comment if you have any questions. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Hey Everybody,

I'm Jeanette DePatie, AKA The Fat Chick. Like many of you, I’m a baby boomer. And as we all know, lots of us have already reached senior status. Studies show that seniors are the least physically fit of all Americans. Thirty percent of men and forty percent of women over the age of  70 reports that they NEVER EXERCISE. That’s sad because there’s no question that regular exercise protects against heart disease, some forms of cancer, diabetes, and can also lower the risk of dementia and decline. And exercise can dramatically improve Quality of Life giving us more energy to do the things we love to do.

So if exercise is so awesome, why aren’t more seniors exercising?

Many seniors have simply never experienced the joy of a workout that truly works for them. For many of us, even the word "EXERCISE" fills us with dread.  Whether it's that PE teacher who tortured us in third grade, the grind of exercise classes that are too easy and mind-numbingly boring or the pain and frustration of workouts that are too hard or even cause injury.

That’s why I am creating EveryBODY Can Exercise: Senior Edition. 

Based on knowledge gleaned over a lifetime of getting my own big butt in motion and decades of teaching people of many ages, shapes, sizes and abilities, I want to help seniors love exercise again or even for the first time ever. My new DVD will help seniors work out in a way that is gentle, flexible and FUN.

Sounds good, doesn't it?  Would you like to strengthen your body, relearn the joy of moving your body and improve your health and live a happier life?

The Fat Chick can help but I need YOUR  help to pay for the production and editing of EveryBODY Can Exercise: Senior Edition. 

JEANETTE DEPATIE:  AKA: The Fat Chick

For those of you who don’t know me, I’m a  plus-sized, certified fitness instructor and personal trainer author, producer and professional speaker who has helped thousands of people who haven’t worked out in a while (or ever) learn to love their bodies and love exercise again. I’m the author of the best-selling book and DVD, The Fat Chick Works Out!

I've earned fitness certifications from the YMCA, ACE and AFAA including special certifications for working with seniors.  My mission is to inspire beginning exercisers of a variety of ages, sizes, shapes and abilities. I’ve been interviewed many times on television, radio and in print by Katie Couric, NPR, Dr. Drew, Hallmark’s Home and Family, Al Jazeera America, CTV (Canada), Huffington Post Live, Women’s Health, Scholastic Magazine, The New York Times, and The Wall St. Journal.

EveryBODY Can Exercise recognizes that Every BODY is different.  Not all bodies can exercise to the same level or exercise in the same way.  A workout that may be safe and perfect for one body may be totally not right for another.  That's why EveryBODY Can Exercise DVD will be unique in it's progressive format--the best and safest approach for beginning exercisers (especially seniors). I don't expect seniors who haven't worked out in a while (or ever) to jump right into a 60-minute workout.  My DVD will be filled with more than 15 short segments of only 2-5 minutes each. Seniors are encouraged to begin with a workout  of whatever length feels comfortable to them and then guided to increase their fitness efforts gradually over time.  What's more, the workout is extremely flexible. Chair modifications will allow seniors to choose to exercise either standing or sitting. And the workout can be modified on a day to day basis depending on how the exerciser is feeling that day.  And exercisers will also get a chance to register to track their progress with our unique FREE online tracking tool!

One of the best things about EveryBODY Can Exercise: Senior Edition is the fabulous class of zany seniors working out with Jeanette DePatie. Encompassing a range of shapes, sizes, abilities, and conditions, EveryBODY Can Exercise: Senior Edition's large cast of dancers will make this more than a workout--it's gonna be a PARTY.  We'll be dancing to a wide variety of musical and dance styles including country, jazz, blues, Zydeco, Celtic, Big Band, Bollywood, and lots more! Jeanette's students have been working out together for a long time--some for over a decade and they KNOW how to have a good time while improving their flexibility, range of motion, and overall conditioning. 

 

 

It's time for a workout that doesn't take itself too seriously.  It's time for a workout where seniors can feel like they belong.  It's time for a workout where seniors can let loose and be silly and have a great time.  It's time for a workout that seniors CAN'T WAIT to do.  It's time for EveryBODY Can Exercise: Senior Edition.  And it's time for you to help me make this revolutionary and powerful new health and happiness tool a reality.

Our goal is to raise $3,850.00 and here's what we're going to do with the money:

  1. Filming Permits/Production Insurance:  $800
  2. Location Fee:  $1100
  3. Music Licensing: $450
  4. Equipment Rentals: $400
  5. Hair/Make-up:  $450
  6. Costumes/Props:  $400
  7. Food/Craft Services:  $250

MEET MY PRODUCTION TEAM:

PRODUCER:  BARBARA MULTER-WELLIN has produced and written documentaries and nonfiction shows and series for HBO, Showtime, Lifetime, TLC, KCET, The Discovery Channel, UPN. Lifetime, Fit-TV, TBS and HGTV. She won a 2013 LA Area Emmy for her work on the television series and web series, "Your Turn to Care" that was also the winner of a 2013 Gracie Award. Barbara has produced and written two films for the acclaimed PBS documentary series, “Independent Lens.” “Taking the Heat The First Women Firefighters of New York City,” a documentary narrated by Susan Sarandon, is about the 20-year struggle to bring women into the New York Fire Department, an institution traditionally hostile to change rocked by the overwhelming trauma and loss of September 11th. The second film, “Paul Conrad: Drawing Fire,” narrated by Tom Brokaw, tracks the career of three-time Pulitzer Prize-winning editorial cartoonist in the context of pop history of the eleven presidents Conrad has lampooned. She is currently completing a feature documentary about an orchestra for people living with mental illness. Barbara has taught documentary courses at New York Film Academy and ESE Film Workshops, and writing at Urban Possibilities ,supported by a grant from the Poets & Writers Foundation.  She is a graduate of the California Institute of the Arts, a former Chair of New York Film Academy’s Documentary Department and former Chair of the Documentary/Reality Committee of the Producer’s Guild of America.

CINEMATOGRAPHER:  EVAN STULC has worked on roughly a dozen feature films ("As I Lay Dying - Director: James Franco, "Block Island Sound" - Directors:  McManus Brothers ) and multiple commercials (Toyota, Riot Games, Yahoo)  as an assistant cameraman. Additionally, he has served as Director of Photography for a slew of corporate spots, promos, interviews and shorts. His work has appeared on FunnyorDie and local PBS stations. Evan started in still photography, a passion he has honed over the past 15 years and across multiple formats. While attending Emerson College (Boston, MA), he transitioned his studies to cinematography. After spending his final semester interning at Partizan Entertainment, he decided to move to Los Angeles permanently in 2011. 

DIRECTOR/EDITOR:  ALLYSON MANNO has produced and directed fiction and non-fiction shorts and web-series and worked on "Super Sex", written and directed by Matthew Modine (2016) that was nominated for best narrative short at the Tribeca Film Festival and winner of the Jury award at the Dublin International Film Festival. She received her bachelors in communications from the University of St. Thomas, Houston, TX and her masters in Filmmaking from the New York Film Academy.

story:
About the Project

We will be driving a 15 seater Ford Transit mini bus filled with clothes, sports clothing, sports equipment, powdered baby milk, disposable nappies, children’s stationary and shoeboxes filled with toys from Ireland to Shatila Refugee camp.  The mini bus will be donated to Real Palestine Youth F.C and Girls Basketball Team.  

About Shatila Refugee camp

Shatila refugee camp in Lebanon is one of the most over crowded refugee camps in the Middle East and is currently overwhelmed with the dramatic influx of refugees fleeing Syria.  Lebanon now has over one million Syrian refugees, according to a recent government estimate. Many have nowhere to go, have few possessions and are struggling to survive.

Electricity supply in the camp averages about 3-4 hours a day.  All safe drinking water in the camp has to be purchased and there is no adequate refuse collection system which has resulted in an infestation of rats.  The whole camp poses a serious health risk to everyone living there.  Conditions in Shatila refugee camp can only be described as sub human.  

About Real Palestine Youth F.C and Shatila Girls’ Basketball Team

Real Palestine Youth F.C and Shatila Girls’ Basketball Team provide 30-40 hours a week of football, basketball and urban sports education for young people aged 8-16 years old in Sabra and Shatila Refugee Camps in Lebanon.

The project provides recreational, coaching and developmental sessions and runs competitions across a wide range of activities.

It offers opportunities for young people to develop healthy and positive lifestyles through coaching programmes delivered in the locally hired pitches.  Sport is a brilliant way to integrate individuals in society, prevent conflict and build peace.  Although sport alone cannot prevent wars or build peace, it can make a major contribution, and there can be no question that this project has the potential to do that.

The Impact

The mini bus will also be rented out for $300 per month and the money from this will pay for a full time coach to train up to 100 boys and girls each year. As long as the bus is maintained it will provide the club with a sustainable income for up to five years. 

The clothes will be distributed to various community groups within the camp.  They will make a massive difference to the Syrian refugees who fled their homes with little more than the clothes on their backs, some of the Syrian refugees have been living Shatila for over two years.


Convoy Team

David Callander (Creative Humanity Partnership)

Eddie Mc Bride (Derry to Gaza) 

Diane Kenny (Creative Humanity Partnership)

Marie Lou Lou (Creative Humanity Partnership) France


The Cost

We need to raise £5,000.  So far we have raised £1,000 and also collected enough clothes and children’s stationary to fill the bus. 

2004/05 Ford Transit 15 seater mini bus £3,500  & Fuel, Ferries, Road tolls & Insurance, approx. £1,500 Total = £5,000

100 percent of the money raised will go towards the mini bus and delivering it to Shatila refugee camp.  We will be paying for our own expenses during the trip and flights home.

We’ve added some short video's describing the conditions in the camp.  We will also be producing a documentary film about our trip and you will see exactly where and what your support went to.

Thank you for your support,

Very Best,

David and Eddie

Le Projet

Nous allons conduire un mini bus Ford Transit de 15 places rempli de vêtements, de vêtements de sport, d'équipements sportifs, de lait infantile en poudre, de couches jetables, de matériel de dessin pour enfants et de boîtes à chaussure remplies de jouets, depuis l'Irlande et jusqu'au camp de réfugiés de Shatila, où Real Palestine Youth F.C et Girls Basketball Team hériteront du mini bus à notre arrivée.  

Le camp de réfugiés de Shatila

Le camp de réfugiés de Shatila au Liban compte parmi les plus peuplés du Moyen Orient. Aujourd'hui, à cause de l'afflux de réfugiés fuyant la Syrie, ce camp est en surpopulation. Les données officielles montrent que le Liban accueille actuellement plus d'un million de réfugiés syriens. Beaucoup n'ont nulle part où aller, n'ont pratiquement pas de possessions personnelles et doivent se battre quotidiennement pour leur survie. 

L'électricité fonctionne entre 3 et 4 heures par jour dans le camp. L'eau potable est payante et il n'existe aucun système de ramassage des ordures, ce qui a conduit à une invasion de rats. L'état de santé des habitants du camp est menacé et les conditions de vie y sont inhumaines.  

Real Palestine Youth F.C et Shatila Girls’ Basketball Team

Real Palestine Youth F.C et Shatila Girls’ Basketball Team offre entre 30 et 40 heures par semaine de football, basketball et d'éducation sportive urbaine aux jeunes âgés de 8 à 16 ans vivant dans les camps de réfugiés de Sabra et Shatila au Liban.

Il s'agit de  recreational, coaching and developmental sessions and ainsi que l'organisation de competitions sportives dans de nombreux domaines. across a wide range of activities.

Ce projet donne accès aux jeunes à un mode de vie sain et positif grâce aux programmes de coaching organisés localement sur des terrains loués pour l'occasion. Le sport est un moyen formidable permettant d'intégrer individus et société, de prévenir les conflits et de construire la paix. Le sport seul n'empêche pas la guerre et ne conduit pas à la paix mais il y contribue, et c'est ce que ce projet cherche à réaliser.

L'Impact

Par ailleurs, le mini bus sera mis en location pour $300 par mois et l'argent récolleté permettra de payer money from this will pay for a full time coach to train up to 100 garçons et filles chaque année boys and girls each year. Si le bus est bien entretenu, il pourra constituer une source de revenu pour le club sur une durée de cinq ans. 

Les vêtements seront distribués à divers groupes locaux dans le camp. cela représente un apport considérable pour les réfugiés syriens qui ont fui leur pays avec pour seul baggage les vêtements qu'ils avaient sur le dos, certains d'entre eux vivant à Shatila depuis plus de deux ans. 

Nous (eux)

David Callander (Creative Humanity Partnership) et Eddie Mc Bride (Derry to Gaza) ont pris part à cinq convois humanitaires vers la bande de Gaza au cours des cinq dernières années. Ils étaient du convoi Viva Palestina monté à la suite des attaques de 2008/2009 sur Gaza. David a aidé à charger un camion de sept tonnes et demi rempli de médicaments et de matériel médical et de 300 boîtes à chaussures de jouets. Il s'agit des premiers jouets arrivés à Gaza après le blocus israelien de 4 ans.  Eddie a quant à lui participé au premier convoi reliant Derry à Gaza, livrant une ambulance Mercedes remplie d'équipement médical.

Le coût 

Nous avons besoin de £5,000. Nous avons déjà collecté £1,000 et nous avons suffisamment de vêtements et de matériel de dessin pour enfants pour remplir un bus. 

Mini bus 2004/05 Ford Transit 15 places= £3,500  & Essence, Ferries, Péages & Assurance, environ £1,500 -- Total = £5,000

100 pourcent de l'argent collecté est affecté au mini bus et à son convoyage vers le camp de réfugiés de Shatila. Nous finançons nos dépenses pendant le voyage ainsi que les billets de retour.

Sur le site du projet, vous pourrez visionner quelques courtes vidéos montrant les conditions de vie dans le camp. Nous produisons un documentaire sur le voyage qui vous permettra de voir de visu comment et où votre soutien a été utilisé.

Merci de votre soutien,

Bien à vous,

David et Eddie
story_txt:
About the Project
We will be driving a
15 seater Ford Transit mini bus filled with clothes, sports clothing, sports
equipment, powdered baby milk, disposable nappies, children’s stationary and shoeboxes
filled with toys from Ireland to Shatila Refugee camp.  The mini bus will be
donated to Real Palestine Youth F.C and Girls Basketball Team.  
About Shatila Refugee camp

Shatila refugee camp in
Lebanon is one of the most over crowded refugee camps in the Middle East and is
currently overwhelmed with the dramatic influx of refugees fleeing Syria. 
Lebanon now has over one million Syrian refugees, according to a recent government estimate. Many have nowhere
to go, have few possessions and are struggling to survive.
Electricity supply in the camp averages about
3-4 hours a day.  All safe drinking water in the camp has to be purchased and there
is no adequate refuse collection system which has resulted in an infestation of
rats.  The whole camp poses a serious health risk to everyone living there.  Conditions in Shatila refugee camp can only be described as sub human.  
About Real Palestine Youth F.C and Shatila Girls’ Basketball TeamReal Palestine Youth F.C and Shatila Girls’ Basketball Team provide 30-40 hours a week of football, basketball and urban sports education for young people aged 8-16 years old in Sabra and Shatila Refugee Camps in Lebanon.The project provides recreational, coaching
and developmental sessions and runs competitions across a wide range of
activities.
It offers opportunities for young people to
develop healthy and positive lifestyles through coaching programmes delivered in the
locally hired pitches.  Sport is a brilliant way to integrate
individuals in society, prevent conflict and build peace.  Although
sport alone cannot prevent wars or build peace, it can make a major contribution, and there can be no question
that this project has the potential to do that.
The ImpactThe mini bus will also be rented out for $300 per month and the money from this will pay for a full time coach to train up to 100 boys and girls each year. As long as the bus is maintained it will provide the club with a sustainable income for up to five years. The clothes will be
distributed to various community groups within the camp.  They will make a massive
difference to the Syrian refugees who fled their homes with little more than the clothes on
their backs, some of the Syrian refugees have been living Shatila for over two years.Convoy TeamDavid Callander (Creative Humanity Partnership)Eddie Mc Bride (Derry to Gaza) Diane Kenny (Creative Humanity Partnership)Marie Lou Lou (Creative Humanity Partnership) FranceThe Cost
We need to raise £5,000. 
So far we have raised £1,000 and also collected enough clothes and children’s
stationary to fill the bus. 2004/05 Ford Transit 15 seater mini bus £3,500  & Fuel, Ferries, Road tolls & Insurance,
approx. £1,500 Total = £5,000
100 percent of the money raised will go towards the mini bus
and delivering it to Shatila refugee camp.  We will be paying for our
own expenses during the trip and flights home.
We’ve added some short
video's describing the conditions in the camp.  We will also be producing a documentary film about our trip and you will see exactly where and what your support went to.Thank you for your
support,Very Best,David and Eddie

story:
My Mother has recently found out that she has  colorectal cancer (Bowel cancer) and that it is very advanced. She was between jobs at the time and is to undergo radio- and chemotherapy. Given this, She has little money and thus I decided to begin a fundraiser to save her. I have a beautiful life set up in North Melbourne, plenty of friends, nice-ish house and if my mum were to... die, then I would be forced to fly over to France where my dad lives not to mention the absolutely traumatising experience. I have never lost any of my relatives and I don't want to start with my mother.

So please, put yourself in my shoes and give a little. Also If the amount is raised by the 1st of July then I will shave my gorgeous hair and post the video of it on the website.

story:
What It's About

Jordie Jordan aka WingsofRedemption weighs over 440lbs and we're going to do something about it!

What We Need & What You Get

So what we do with your money really depends upon how much of it we can milk out of you with promises of karma and goodwill.  Seriously though you're helping to pay for the basics of course, things like healthy foods, and basic day to day supplies.   If there is enough left over after that then things start getting fun!  We'll build the obstacle course, buy things like costumes and makeup, and generally get crazy with it!  If we exceed our goals then we could bring in personal trainers, camera operators, and generally step up production quality.

The Impact

If this project is a success, then we will have made Jordie a happier, healthier, man with the tools he needs to make success a habit.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help

Help spread the word about what we're doing here, and our campaign, its like money except not as tangible and rewarding haha!

story:
MOUTI is the new educational toothbrush for kids. Our educational system is what makes it so special.

Because of our original educational system, MOUTI turns daily brushing into a unique educational experience. MOUTI uses colored lights to teach your child to associate colors with each part of the mouth, making it fun and easy for them to learn how to brush their teeth and to form healthy teeth brushing habits. With MOUTI your children will learn how to brush every part of their mouth for a certain time, completing a total of 2 minutes, the time recommended by experts. Moreover, its educational system offers a safe and more efficient alternative for kids with special needs.

  

A system of 4 steps

With our educational system it's so easy to achieve the recommended 2 minutes of brushing! You only need: MOUTI, the 4 pictograms with our characters, and lots of fun.

 

1. BLUE: Front of the teeth

To start, MOUTI will light up with a blue light for 35 seconds during which your kids will brush the front of their teeth. You can use the blue pictogram to guide them. 

 

 

2. RED: Back of the teeth

Automatically after 35 seconds the red light will turn on. Red means kids brush the back of their teeth for 35 more seconds.

o

                              

3. GREEN: Molars

With the green light your kids will know it's time to brush their molars, also for 35 seconds.

                          

3. YELLOW: Tongue

Finishing with the yellow light your children will brush their tongue for 15 seconds.

                                   

The family of Mouti products is made up of 3 elements: the toothbrush, the pictograms, and the app for parents.

 

 

1. The Toothbrush

An interactive toothbrush with colored timed lights, with a unique design that helps foster the correct use from children. Also interchangeable heads, ultra hygienic material, amusingly soft and chewy, shockproof and waterproof.  Comes with a rechargeable internal battery.

 

  • Features and Benefits Our product has unique features that make it truly amazing, 100% designed for children.

 

​ ​Colorful and funny design:  Your children can choose between these 4 colorful  and fun MOUTI designs.

  1. Dinosaur Green
  2. Bubblegum Pink
  3. Banana Yellow
  4. Blue Whale

 

2. Adhesive pictograms

Each one of these fun characters represents an area of the mouth that should be brushed properly. They are easy for children to associate with the colored lights of the toothbrush. You can stick them on the mirror in your bathroom or anywhere you want.

These pictograms are made of waterproof and ultra-adhesive material, so you can stick them any flat surface with no problem! They are designed so you can use them to reinforce the learning  process of your kids.

They work great as a visual stimulus especially for children with concentration problems, cognitive disability, ASD, and Down syndrome, among others.

 

3.Parents' App

With the parents’ app now it's so much easier to know if your child is doing things right. You will have reliable daily data of your kids’ progress, and above all you can use that to congratulate your children for their achievements with fun rewards.

  • The Mouti app works along with the smart toothbrush. The aim of the app is to help parents and children to learn and form habits of good oral hygiene at home, and over time generate habits in the family routine.

 

Our app is intended to be used by parents or caregivers and it does not need to be synchronize every time for your kid to use MOUTI.

Within the app for parents there is an educational section for children, which will give you oral care tips and information. Plus, you can review your kids’ achievements and progress and give them positive reinforcements.

​

The dentists and oral hygienist will receive information from their little patients and will be able to see their monthly progress. The app will provide real information about the teeth brushing habits of the children. Thus, they can have medical records and can congratulate them for their achievements in each medical check up.

 

Studies conducted by experts from around the world, dentists, child psychologists and educators confirm the importance of parental support to create oral hygiene habits at an early age in children, so that they last throughout life. 

 

Validated with our users

We have done internal tests with more than 80 children of different ages, nationalities, and children with special cognitive needs, obtaining excellent results with everyone!

 

Our specialists and parents approve!

They have already known and tested our educational system! What are you waiting for?

 

We need your support

Bai-mey Chea was in her last year of a degree in design when she felt inspired by her little friend Micah, who has Down syndrome to create MOUTI. She wanted to help him improve his oral health. That's how the idea was born. From Chile to the world, it's the new educational toothbrush for kids that is real and useful alternative for kids with special needs.

 

We have worked hard

None of the kids featured in our campaign video is a professional actor. We wanted to show real and daily case scenarios of parents' frustration and happiness with their kids. Some of our little friends have tested our product since our early prototypes. We've seen them grow up. They're our motivation in designing a product that will improve their oral health and quality of life, and not just theirs but of thousands of kids around the world. Some of featured kids in our video have Down syndrome, ADD and Autism, because inclusion is very important for our company and our products.

 

Our creative process

Our team has researched for years, we have done tests with children and parents and we have created more than 50 prototypes. We received collaborations from specialists in the area of ​​oral health, design and business.Together we have co-created the best educational toothbrush!

 

We have worked with DMO design company to perfect and define our final product and product engineering and we manufactured our beta product with star rapid company.

 

Our company and our products have been recognised in Chile and also abroad for its innovation and inclusive design.

 

Risks and Challenges

Prior to the delivery of our product we have to certify our product. We need financial resources to start the paperwork which occasionally might delay our production process. On the other hand, shipping MOUTI overseas could eventually suffer complications with customs. However, we believe in our product and we want to assure you that we work hard to deliver the best to our clients at the earliest possible time.

 

This campaign represents a big step to achieve our first production line and for the world to meet the new educational experience of oral hygiene for children. We need your support.

Join us and let's do it together!

 

www.mouti.co
