story:
The Lovers' Dream has been developed to enhance pleasure and passion during the most intimate moments of couples’ lovemaking, because we all want a healthier and more exciting sexual experience. Couples deserve to have adventure and excitement, even after being in a relationship for years or, with a new friend.


The revolutionary Lovers' Dream has been specifically designed to fit snug, deep within her. The unique shape still allows him to fit alongside comfortably. Once in position, the Lovers' Dream will remain in place, creating a more natural ‘hands-free’ and thrilling adventure for both partners. The Lovers Dream will make her tighter and shallower for him, and for her; he will be thicker and longer, with the addition of 3 vibrations, we expect great things to happen for couples.



The Lovers' Dream provides variable vibrations in 3 erotic zones – the clitoris, the g-spot and extra stimulation deep inside.

The specially shaped bullet tip can be placed either on the clitoral area or in the anal position, and the bulb is designed to keep the product in, and massage him at the same time. Lovers' Dream delivers out of this world stimulation for both partners simultaneously and that is the key to the Lovers' Dream, it is a genuine lovers product for couples to use together to create more intimacy and a deeper connection ….

However, if so desired, the Lovers' Dream is perfect for solo play. There is truly nothing else like the Lovers' Dream.


  • Made of Body-Safe, Medical Quality Silicone
  • Hands Free
  • Fully Rechargeable
  • Makes Her Tighter & Shallower for Him
  • Makes Him Thicker & Longer for Her
  • Water Resistant
  • 5 Modes
  • 4 Speed Cycles - Gentle through to Intense
  • Designed for Lovers or Solo use


Although the Lovers' Dream is completely new on the market, this innovative product has been researched, conceptualized, developed and re-developed over the course of many years. We have successfully reached this exciting stage of our development by working with some of the top consultants in the business, including one of the very best design engineering companies in the world. We believe that we have designed an amazing product, and as far as we know, the Lovers' Dream is one of the very few dual function sexual aid products in the world.

With patents secured in the US, Canada, South Africa, Hong Kong, China, Austrailia & pending in the EU, Brazil and India, we have already successfully produced a variety of functioning prototype models for testing and review. So far, all of the lucky couples invited to try the Lovers' Dream have been both blown away by the unparalleled stimulation and deeply satisfying sensations it creates.


We love our two colors. The Lovers' Dream will be available in both Sky Blue and Vivid Purple.


We have been self-funded up to this point, but not for the production of the first 5,000 units. We've secured patents in the US, Canada, South Africa, Hong Kong, China, Australia, the EU, Brazil and India, registered companies, employed one of the best design and engineering companies and negotiated with the appropriate sales channel partners.

The manufacturing process has been approved and we have completed the molds and ordered all electronic components to start pilot run of the first 50 products off the manufacture's line for further quality control and testing.



Lawrence Mark : Founder / Inventor

Hi, my name is Lawrence Mark and I am the Inventor of the Lovers' Dream and majority shareholder of Blue Dreams Global Inc. & Blue Dreams Co. Ltd. I have always had an experimental, adventurous, open-minded and fun loving attitude to making love. I had an experience in 2001 while having fun in bed playing around with my girlfriend at the time, which was incredible for both of us.

This experience led me to invent the first prototype of the Lovers' Dream. That was the beginning of many years  of challenges, accomplishments and ongoing improvements to create the perfect product which simultaneously enhances and heightens the love making experience for couples at the same time. I am grateful to all of my  loving friends who helped to balance the scales in my favour always. Blue Dreams has been granted Patents in all of the major global territories and we are about to share my DREAM with everyone all over the World. 

Why I need your help :

From the inception of this idea, it’s been a taboo.  My associates, most of my friends and some of my family do not even want to discuss it because of the nature of this business of sex. One of my sisters says I will go straight to hell.  My eldest brother will not even discuss it.  My mother laughs at it now, but it wasn’t a laughing matter to her ten years ago.

I did not have the money when I got the idea, and I still don’t have all of the money we need now.  I have had to form a company so that I could assign the patents to the company, so that my friends, could feel some kind of security when they invested their money in my idea and me.

I have had friends put up security, even put up their house to the Bank and the Bank blatantly refused because of the nature of this business.  I have struggled all through these years piece by piece putting this puzzle together.  On many occasions I gave up only to wake up the next morning on fire again to keep this project going

Blue Dream Global Inc. has now achieved most of its objectives and passed many milestones.  We are at the stage of pre-production in the factory right now. 

I am reaching out to all of you to please be part of this amazing journey by helping me fund the first production run..

Any support that you choose to give me would be greatly appreciated. Please share in my Dream to bring joy, heightened excitement, increasing pleasure and closer bonds to couples all over the world.

Angelina Stasos: Consultant

Angelina, our vibrant resource for style, aesthetics, form and function provides us with invaluable insight from the female perspective. It was very important to us from the beginning, to create a couple’s product that was equally desirable to both males and females, and really did achieve and exceed the desired results. 

Angelina has always been a dynamic and sexually aware individual and with her unique blend of style, flair and yet functional orientation, her input guides us and allows us to strive for the best possible product with a successful broad appealing concept.

Being a huge fan of the Lovers’ Dream, Angelina is keen to see the success and hear the feedback from satisfied ‘Lovers’.

Angelina hails from Greece, has lived in London and now calls Sydney, Australia her home.


Michael Bassett : Consultant

Michael Bassett, renowned Pleasure Product industry professional, has joined BDGI in a consulting capacity to guide the development and global marketing and sales of the Lovers' Dream.

Michael has recently stepped down after 6 years as CEO at Calvista, Australia’s largest importer and distributor of adult pleasure products. In this time of changing market conditions and recessive economies, he expanded Calvista’s product ranges and sales volumes and secured many exclusive and highly lucrative pleasure product sales agreements including the highly successful We-Vibe from Standard Innovation Corporation, Canada.  He is regarded as one of the few people in the world who were instrumental in the early sales success of this product and company. 

Prior to Calvista, Michael managed the German operations of the ecommerce adult retailer adultshop.com and later orchestrated its sale to one of Germany’s largest erotic conglomerates.

Fluent in German and English, with degrees in psychology, marketing and management, Bassett lived in Hamburg, in Germany’s north for 12 years and gained mainstream corporate expertise as Manager Europe, Middle East and Africa for Minolta’s hi tech 3D Division.


Note from the Design-Engineering Team...

In late April of 2014, our design team engaged with Lawrence and the product began to take shape.  A very detail-oriented person, Lawrence was actively involved and using a variety of custom online collaboration tools the design team work remotely with Lawrence to define and steer the product direction.

The combined team of designers, electronic/mechanical engineers and commercialization staff dug in and worked closely ensuring Lawrence’s vision of the product was maintained.  The Bill of Materials was scrutinized as the team worked to remove cost where feasible with Lawrence being ever vigilant that quality was maintained.

A fully functioning prototype was fabricated, tested and forwarded to Lawrence and his investor team.  The reaction was incredible! This was the a-ha moment they were able to touch the very first completely working  'Lovers Dream' and a product was born. 

Minor refinements to the product were implemented as the learning from the prototype led to revision to the intense pleasure vibration modes, final fit to body shape and ease of assembly. For successful products, the combination of design, engineering and manufacturing in one studio really accelerates the design process.  The in-house manufacturing support team went to work with Lawrence to develop relationships with proven quality suppliers that would turn on the high volume production. 

As you read this it is likely that the first units are rolling off the production  line.   The team will evaluate, recommend and implement any last refinements that are identified and yes... to celebrate a little bit.  No doubt some user testing will occur!!!

We look forward to the next step in the process - a full production launch in the very near future.

On a personal note, we have come to know this product and Lawrence very well.  We spoke often over many months exploring the opportunity to work together.  On one Friday evening we talked for over an hour, remotely and in two different locations, worlds apart, both parties with wine in hand, long before we ever worked together.  Lawrence and his business team had to overcome numerous obstacles and never wavered from their vision. Our role as the creative implementers is to steer Lawrence through the physical hardware product development and find the perfect solution to his vision. 

We are extremely proud of the achievement.  We know the market will love this product.  This is not the end, but rather the beginning.  We invite you to join us in this journey.

Congratulations to Lawrence Mark and the business team at Blue Dreams. 

This product is a winner!


Michael Bassett, Adult Novelty and Pleasure Product Industry Expert

When I first heard of the Lovers' Dream I was very impressed! When I learnt more, I was convinced and wanted to be part of the team! For several years now, there has been little real innovation in adult pleasure product. Sure, there are a few highlights here and there but nothing that really jumps out at you as a major game changer!   “The Lovers' Dream is a ‘real’ game changer”that will come in many shapes, sizes, colors and varieties of electronic configurations. There are 2 more distinctly different products under the same concept and patents, to follow, that will also be shared with the World in time.

There are a plethora of vibrators and massagers on the market, predominantly used for female solo play and this arena is heavily saturated.  By its very nature, being a couple’s product, the Lovers' Dream will gain mass mainstream attention.  We have seen first hand the success of other couples devices, well constructed items made with attention to detail, materials, ergonomics and reliability. The couples market for adult product is lucrative due to its size and its acceptance of a mutual sexual aid. Couples who have been together for some time, females who have had children- this is a sizeable global audience with a combined and established disposable income and many of these will purchase this product.  This isn’t marketing hype, I know it, as I’ve sold millions of dollars of such items for many years.

The Lovers' Dream has all the right elements. It has a smooth body safe silicon shell, it’s phthalate free, is rechargeable, has 3 vibrating motors, it looks great and is designed for use by couples during penetration whilst providing clitoral stimulation. It provides a sense of being fulfilled in every way for both parties whilst offering simultaneous orgasm. As a bonus, if desired, it can be rotated and used also for anal play. It is a Lovers' Dream!

The global potential in terms of sales of this product is enormous. It will be sold in every country in the world that doesn’t prohibit the sales of adult pleasure product and with the proliferation of adult product and awareness via ecommerce and social media, it will reach even the most distant places quite swiftly.  The Lovers’ Dream will bring pleasure, and pleasure back, to many couples and lovers all over the world.


We now need to fund the first production run of 5000 units at the Factory and have these packaged and ready for global distribution and sale.

We estimate we require at least US$75,000 to fund production, packaging, freight and warehousing plus the entire sales process including trade show and booth costs, travel, accommodation and sales staff. Once we've made our first sales and revenue is flowing, our cash flow situation will improve but we must first get through the first tough 6 months of business establishment.  We're confident we have a very special and unique product and we are well protected with patents plus we have the relevant industry experienced personnel on board!

The PERKS that we have constructed aim to give you the choice according to your desires, budget and geographical location. We hope you like them and that there is something suitable for you.  

The Early Bird VIP single and twin pack deals offer fantastic value at 45% - 50% off MSRP. You will be the first to receive the Lovers' Dream at a never to be repeated price.  You won't be able to buy these products retail at this price!

The 12 month Beta testing program for US$500- $600 is a real treat and we can't wait to have you closely involved. This is very special and you will work closely with our product development teams.

AND for $5,000 you'll be traveling to a US or European ADULT INDUSTRY TRADE SHOW and having us show you around, accommodation and spending money,  well that is VERY special indeed! This is a unique opportunity to see first hand, the global adult pleasure product industry from the inside!


All money raised will go toward funding production and getting the Lovers' Dream into the hands of loving couples world wide. Blue Dreams Global Inc. (BDGI) does have access to USD 300,000.00 if this campaign fails so those of you concerned about your perks not being honoured because of lack of campaign funds please don't concern yourself your perk is very safe with us.


One current challenge is the depressed state of our global economies. There just isn't as much discretionary income at our disposal as there was a few years ago, things are a lot tighter now for most consumers.  Fortunately, we have a killer product, its a premium pleasure item made from silicon, is rechargeable and used by couples for simultaneous pleasure and thus it has widespread appeal.  Our industry knowledge also informs us, its a very good time to release this product right now, the market is hungry for it and we have very strong expressions of interest from the industry.  

As we also have many more products in the pipeline, the Lovers' Dream will experience product extension and there will be a family of wonderful pleasure products further enhancing our footprint in retail and online.


Don't sweat it, we would however,  love it,  if you could help us spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and colleagues and please make use of the Indiegogo share tools!


Help us make something amazing!

story:
We recently found out that Johnny has a cancerous mole that is in the early stage of Melanoma (which runs in his family). Luckily, being caught in its early stage, it can be removed without turning into cancer if surgery is performed as soon as possible.

We started this campaign because Johnny is a full time college student and part time worker who doesn't even get financial aid. He works hard every day of his life to pay off his schooling and to be self sufficient. He never asks anyone for help because he doesn't want to burden them but anyone that knows him knows that he is always the first person to offer help whenever someone needs it.

Right now johnny is in a tough spot, he had to pay $200 for the biopsy and now needs to pay $500 for the actual surgery, just weeks before he needs to pay his college tuitions. He doesn't even have insurance to help cover any of the costs. So we are trying to help him as much as possible.

Any donations at all are greatly appreciated, even if the goal isn't reached, any sort of assistance will help. Thank you all so much!

*anything extra will go towards the $200 biopsy bill!*

story:
Hello,

I am Gerri's granddaughter, Brittany. I have decided to create a daily/weekly journal for updates regarding my grandmother's health. My goal in creating this is to start a growing prayer chain in honor of Gerri Montgomery. I want God's prayer warriors to fervently pray for the healing of such an amazing woman. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE include others in your praying for her!! It is very much appreciated and I know she is so thankful for you. This journal is solely based on her request for prayers.

Let me explain... on July 17th of this year my grandmother went to the doctor for due to some bumps in her mouth that had been irritating her. It was after several appointments that she was diagnosed with Squamous cancer (oral cancer). After having a CT scan completed for her mouth, doctors happen to notice some spots appear on her upper right lung. Several appointments later, my grandmother was diagnosed with Stage 3 or Stage 4 (yet to be determined) lung cancer.

What you can do:

By living with my grandmother, I've learned so much. She once told me: "God doesn't just help people that don't care. They have to have the 'want to' in them". Now more than ever, I believe that. My 'want to' is steadfast, whole-hearted prayer for my grandma to circulate in this nation and within the world. Please remember her name when you're talking to God.

 

Thank you and God bless you. I will post more updates as soon as they come.

Several appointments later, my grandmother was diagnosed with Stage 3 or Stage 4 (yet to be determined) lung cancer.
What you can do:
By living with my grandmother, I've learned so much. She once told me: "God doesn't just help people that don't care. They have to have the 'want to' in them". Now more than ever, I believe that. My 'want to' is steadfast, whole-hearted prayer for my grandma to circulate in this nation and within the world. Please remember her name when you're talking to God.
 
Thank you and God bless you. I will post more updates as soon as they come.

story:
Short Summary

Namaste!

“Namaste” is not just a greeting in Hindi but it means ‘I Bow to You’ and ‘We’re All One’. With this in heart, I welcome you to participate in our campaign TriCycle For TriColor.

My name is Agastya Kapoor and I am a Time-Rich-Social-Entrepreneur from Mumbai, India. I realized that the almighty has given me two hands, not to collect but also to give and with the intention of community service, I founded a social enterprise called "SOMEONE.SOMEWHERE." Inspired by Mother Teresa, we don't wait for leaders. We do it alone, person to person.

We do small things with great love | www.someonesomewhere.org

We’re also on Facebook | www.facebook.com/Someone.Somewhere.India

There are around 2.6 million disabled people living (in dreadful condition) in India; as per census of 2013. Rural areas have more disabled people than urban areas. Most of the disabled are those with movement disability | http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Disabled-population-up-by-22-4-in-2001-11/articleshow/28072371.cms

Through our modest campaign, we desire to reach as many people as possible and gift them a typical ‘Handicap TriCycle’ available in India. Reaching out to these three men is our beginning because a very close friend is serving a community of rag-pickers in Nangli village, near Amritsar, Punjab, India.

This campaign not only support the needy money-poor disabled people but also ignite a spark among citizens to lend their hand for support. By taking this first step, we want the community to participate for the community and not keep waiting for leaders to help.

What We Need? And What You Get?

We need to purchase three TriCycles from Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India form a vendor called ‘Rashmi Industries’. Below is the details of the expenses per piece.

Heads Per Unit Cost Vale Added Tax (12.5 %) USD (Total)
TriCycle 70 9.3 79.3
Transport (Source city to Destination city) 788 mile 25 Inclusive 25
Transport (Destination city to Destination village) 11 mile 10 Inclusive 10
Maintenance for 10 years 50 Inclusive 50
Grand Total 164.3
That is USD 164. 3 x 3 = USD 492.3 , rounded off to USD 500.


Please remember it’s not about amount but about participation in compassion. 

We’re not asking for big amounts. We’re encouraging small financial contribution, so that everyone should participate in this noble cause. Contributors will not only get satisfaction of being involved, spreading compassion but also get an opportunity to buy happiness with money; through social spending.


Within a period of one year, our experiment has shared our gratitude, compassion, joy and love to children suffering from cancer, beggars, rag-pickers, workers, Police and Army. Indian Army (and a few others) have appreciated our work this year | www.someonesomewhere.org/#!letters-of-appreciation/ce5q

The Impact

We believe that by inviting people to contribute to our noble cause, we’re not only creating waves of compassion, but supporting a big number of disabled communities in India. This step is small but the repercussions can be big and spread far; like a butterfly effect.

We've being doing little experiments with compassion and have noticed that its impact is exponential. And, we've found that it’s contagious too. More and more people are joining our experiment in a variety of projects | www.someonesomewhere.org/#!sahaanubhuti/c181u

Other Ways You Can Help

There are multiple ways you can contribute:

1.  By volunteering in our campaign

3.  By giving us your feedback on our Facebook page

4.  By sharing our Facebook page

5.  By talking about our campaign to your friends

6.  By praying for us silently

There is one more way you can contribute. If you don’t choose to support us, please do support a cause that ignites your heart. The goodness will come back to us in multiples. 

Founder and Servant Leader (Someone.Somewhere.)

Agastya Kapoor

Mumbai. India

story:
Ongoing work is needed at the GGP Disc Golf Course

  • We need tier work on #11/#16
  • Removing Trash from Trash cans on all Holes
  • Finish the great wall on #6.
  • Add Drain rock to all the tees in need
  • There are more tee signs to be replaced
  • constant maintenance due to ever-increasing foot traffic as daily new disc golfers explore their obsession
  • the necessarily vigilant watch over erosion spots on the course

What we need:

Support through funding to keep the workers on the course part/full-time, providing for and serving the rapidly growing disc golf community in San Francisco and the greater Northern California region.

Through their tireless work and dedication, the Golden Gate Park Disc Golf Course will be the premiere free public course in the United States and the standard by which all other courses, private and public, will be judged in the future.

We've made great strides!

Planting grass in numerous locations to stop and control Erosion on our sand based course.

Purchased a truck to use for hauling and course maintainence, its already earned its place in the SFDGC Fam.

Erosion control on pathway on Hole 12

Drain rock placed around teepads #11 and #12 to stop flooding and mud tees.

The TEMPLE structure on Hole #11

The "Great Wall" on hole #6

Improved teebox area on #12

Drastically reduced play-through times on 11,12,14 with proper maintenance of the hill side.That is now covered in GRASS!!!

New Tee Signs!

More seating!

Erosion control tier on 18 to save main tree by the C pin.

...and last but certainly not least the course is continuing to get more GREEN!

story:
My name is Cindy, and I’m a soon-to-graduate Doctor of Dental Surgery living in New York City. In a lot of ways, dentists are very lucky – we work hard to learn a profession people respect, and we love our jobs. But sometimes we can get a little… uninspired. I’m working to change that.

Being a dentist is about more than just drills and floss – we help people. A woman who gets her smile fixed gets a new job. A younger man whose broken teeth are crowned can see his daughter again without shame. A longer, healthier life is sometimes as simple filling a simple cavity.

I’ve seen these things myself from my dental chair, and I’ve dedicated my time and energy to spreading the word – bringing dental services to people who have no access to them, and sharing with my fellow professionals and all of you around the web the difference it makes.

Dental Outreach: Colombia

Since I started dental school, I’ve participated in two outreach trips to the developing world. The first, to Ecuador in 2012, was a great success – inspiring and thrilling and truly helpful. The second, to the Colombian Amazon in June, 2013, is going to be bigger and better.

On my trip, I will be treating locals with little or no access to dental care, because of a lack of money, education or knowledge. I will be visiting remote areas where dentists are too far to provide regular treatment.

I will be performing a variety of important and difficult procedures. This is not a vacation. But while there, I will document the experiences, growth, learning, and value contributed by the trip. I will update an online journal and be taking pictures to share when I get back.

What will you do with the money?

1)     Transportation – Your contributions will help me travel to and from the Amazon in Colombia and to get around villages and communities while I am there.

2)     Dental materials – Your contributions will also help supply the critical materials I need to treat the patients I will meet along the way.

3)     Sharing the story – Your contribution will also help me share the story of my trip in the hope of inspiring a culture of dentists.

Risks and challenges 

I hope through my work to inspire fellow dental professionals to get out of our comfort zones and challenge ourselves. By giving our time and skills to people who need our help, we can change lives.

I’m only one person — one dentist. The biggest risk with my project is that it stops with me. With your help, it doesn’t have to.

story:
Hi All,

I'm trying to raise funds for my Abdominal plasty operation. I've tried to get this operation on the NHS but it seems if you manage to lose the weight on your own, their not willing to help. Every time I make it to the goal they set, something else is always stopping me.  Having this operation will help me with me confidence not having to wear bigger clothes than I require and allow me to move on in life. If you'd like to Donate, doesn't matter how big or small this is, every little helps. Please see my weightloss story below


I started my weight loss journey 36 months ago, my weight was spiralling out of control and if I didn't do something about it, it would only make my mobility and my health a lot worse. I started my journey at 28 stone 8 pound and with the help and encouragement from my brother Stephen Hocking I wouldn't be where I am today. My confidence when I was 28 stone 8 pound was really affecting me, I never went anywhere without my coat on and would not go to public place...s or into shops when they were busy. I use to avoid going out with friends it would affect me that much. My brother helped my by paying for a personal trainer to help me with my eating habits and also my exercise programme. Don't get me wrong I've had an amazing amount of support from my friends and family. I started of on a detox programme for 3 weeks to try and stop me craving certain food groups. I then started going to a boxing gym with my personal trainer and walking with my colleague/friends. Little by little I increased my exercise and re introduced food groups. I started with a short jog and slowly built it up, i would never jog or even attempt to run in the day or on main roads so i use to get up at 5 - 5:30 most morning or go to places where no one would be. My weight loss would vary from 1 - 4 pound a week. After all this hard work, I'm now a lot more confident, a lot happier, fitter, I enjoy going to the gym and socialising with friends and now have a new way of thinking about food. I still have the old treat whether this be a bag of sweets or a curry, I'll have 1 cheat day a week and then back on to healthy eating. I exercise 3 - 4 times a week and I have even started swimming. I go to the gym on my wn but when they can i go with my sister Vicky Hocking, my nephew Taylor Lucas and will soon be going with my brother Stephen Hocking. I currently only go swimming with my sister. Now i run 6 - 8 miles a week and it doesn't affect me (confidence wise) to run on the main roads or during peak times. My pulse has also come down from 130+ to 39 - 48. If anyone has any questions please comment below.

A big thank you to all my family and friends and to my Personal trainer Giselle Dudley

story:
Under the direction of Dr. Gracie Ann Dinkins, the LACOSC (Liberian-American Community Organization of Southern California) has collected medical supplies to ship to Liberia. These supplies are desperately needed to help health workers combat the Ebola outbreak. And they need them NOW.

This shipment is due to leave Los Angeles for Liberia on October 11th. This can only happen with your help. We need to raise $2000.

Gracie Ann Esther Dinkins was born in Oakland, California to parents who were pursuing graduate studies at UC Berkeley, in 1966. When she was 5 years old, they returned to their native country of Liberia, where she was raised by a medley of nurses, teachers, professors and livestock farmers. She returned to the U.S. and graduated from Cal State, Dominguez Hills with a Degree in Chemistry and matriculated to UC Irvine for medical school. It was during her surgical clinical rotation at the Long Beach VA Hospital that she realized where she was truly happy – in the operating room. Trauma surgery was a specialty that suited her personality and would never bore her. After 3 years in a King/Drew surgery Residency program, she decided to take a break and enjoy a research fellowship at the University of California, San Francisco, where she rediscovered her love for running became an Olympian for the second time, running the 400 meters at the 1996 Atlanta Olympics for Liberia and advancing to the quarterfinals. 

After that excitement, returning to Los Angeles and completing her surgery residency was a relief. She finished a fellowship in Trauma/Critical Care at King/ Drew Center in 1999. An opportunity to work at Long Beach Memorial presented itself, by way of Dr. Ndiforchu and, eventually, Dr. Acker and the trauma service. 

An annual Day Camp and Youth Festival by Dr. Dinkins was established in 2009.

Dr. Dinkins is also a proud member of the Medical Team, established in 1990 by a former Chief Resident of King Drew.  Drs Peter and Leslie Bostick  continue to lead groups of doctors, lawyers, nurses and other professionals around the world every year, performing surgeries, running clinics, and bringing medical supplies to people in need.  The Bosticks continue to serve as her leadership mentors. 

Dr. Dinkins continues to dedicate her time to people that need medical  help throughout the world. The Ebola outbreak in Liberia is in dire need of supplies. Please help us help Dr. Dinkins to help those in need. 

Short Summary

People are dying in Liberia from the Ebola outbreak. We have a shipment ready to go containing supplies to help medical workers.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2000 to get this shipped to people in need.

What do you get back? Not one material thing - no t-shirts, no mugs.

You get the satisfaction that you are making a contribution to help health workers do the work they were trained to do - help people in need.

The Impact

Save lives in Liberia. Help contain an outbreak and keep it from spreading to the rest of the world.

    Risks & Challenges

    Risks? Challenges? Preventing a worldwide epidemic is a start.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Shout it from the rooftops. Email your friends. Post on Facebook. Twitter...

story:
if anyone would like to help with funeral expenses for my grandson, lil angel xadrian in this terrible tragedy please do so any donations will be greatly appreative in this time of need. he needs a decent funeral god bless your hearts. all collected donations will go to the funeral home.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Pauls Journey……

I’m a forty three year old male, who until this month, was yes, overweight, but just a “normal” guy going through life just like the rest of us. Well I’ve just received the wake-up call that has certainly kicked my “Butt” into action.

My Doctor recently told me that I have Diabetes and that my Cholesterol levels were way to high, this compounded by the realisation that I was just too fat and unfit.

Not the rosy picture one wants moving into the prime of their life in their forties.

I NEED HELP – Not a lot, but some guidance and support through these times in getting my health and life in order. It’s better to attack it now than when I become a real burden on my family, friends and society with major health restrictive problems down the track.

Goal

To lose 15 kg in 30 days!
This will kick start me on my quest to lose a total of 44 kg’s getting me under 100kgs. (I currently weigh 143kg)

What we need and what you get!

I am looking for help – I am trying to raise $1,000, of which 30% will go to the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF) helping find a cure for Diabetes.

The balance will help me achieve my goal by paying for a professional, personal “Health Care Administrator” from My Health Journey and enrolling me in their online Global Healthcare portal. More specifically they will help me navigate through the life change that is needed to lose weight and dealing with being a diabetic.

By sponsoring my health goals you will not only have the satisfaction of knowing that you are helping me but will also have the opportunity to receive FREE, the same services that I will be fortunate enough to have.

The Impact

The goal that you will be sponsoring me for is to lose weight (15kg initially, an overall total of about 43kg). But this is really just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to how that will help change my life.

Understanding and getting my diabetes under control is a life changer for me, the other options are not bright and is not a road I want to go down.
I have also applied for a bus driver’s position, but cannot start until I have lost at least 15kg, so it also means meaningful employment.
Lastly, I guess that the old saying that you don’t know what you have until you have lost it, somewhat rings true. This is a wakeup call for me to get my health in order, your sponsorship will help me achieve this.

My promises to you and myself

1)  I will give my health goal priority attention, and will do all within my power to achieve it

2)  I will regularly give updates on my progress for all to see and follow. Not just over the first 30 days but ongoing as I get closer to my long term target of 100 kg.

3)  I will be contactable and will answer any questions or queries that people might have.

4)  I will do a blog of “my health journey” this will hopefully help others who find themselves in my situation.

Below, is more detail about My Health Journey, their global healthcare portal, and the complete programme that your sponsorship will enable me to have.

FAST, AFFORABLE, EFFECTIVE HEALTHCARE

Other Ways You Can Help

-  If you are inspired by this project and would like others to be involved please pass this message along via your social media outlets, facebook, twitter etc.

-  Get involved – Like the idea of getting your health in order, but not having to do it alone, PLUS have cutting edge technology to help you along with way. Contact us, and we can get you introduced to a personal Health care administrator immediately getting you onto the path to success.

Myhealthjourney.com was created to provide fast, effective and affordable healthcare. We achieve this by connecting patients with Healthcare Professionals and the patients’ medical records in one place. We also provide the services of a personal healthcare administrator to help patients reach their healthcare goals. Together, we can create a better healthcare system.

story:
Gemibee UV Deluxe is the idea about to combine technology and fashion 

By looking at the emerging trends in both the fashion and tech world, we believe that it becomes possible to apply UV sanitizing device to a fashionable cosmetic organizer or jewelry box - designed specifically for ladies and the professional makeup artists!

Putting makeup on face and wear accessories can brighten up your days!  Now more than ever, you need to make sure all your beauty tools are properly cleaned and disinfection to be an essential part of your beauty routine.

We paint and highlight our faces with makeup brushes every day so it's important to keep our brushes fresh, clean and germ free.

(Invisible bacteria in our daily environment)

 

Gemibee UV Deluxe does the work for you!

 

What it is

A smart and luxury case to give you a place to store and organize your beauty essentials together, the UVC function optimize its value to protect your favorite products from damage and clean.

What it does

It is the smart & multi-functional use of beauty organizer and UV sanitizer. It provides a physical, eco-friendly and safe way of surface sterilization.   With the latest technology and accurate UVC light to reach 99% sterilizing rate. 

How to use

It’s a super-fast, effective cleaning and sanitizing device for your beauty essentials.

 

UV disinfection works in 4 simple steps:

  1. Place the items to be sterilized in the silver compartment of the UVC case and zip the case;

     

  2. Connect the case with a power source (e.g. power bank) via USB cable;

     

  3. Blue light is on for sanitizing process for 3 minutes;

     

  4. When blue light is off, UVC disinfection is completed.

     

Gemibee UV Deluxe comes with TWO styles:

 

1) The Vanity Case

A handy cosmetics organizer and sanitizer to allow you to keep your favorite beauty products well organized and allow you to store them with ease. The value added UV disinfection works quickly and complete efficiently for sanitizing items like makeup brushes, tools, mobile phone, more without harsh steam. The case comes with a removable zippered pouch, a mirror and protected brush holders, making it both a solid way to clean up your beauty essentials at home and a useful travel companion.

2) The Cube

A nice and compact cube for storing and sanitizing your fashion accessories like jewelry, hair clips, watches, contact lens cases etc.  The cube comes with two strap holders for necklaces and earrings, a pouch for bangles or hair clips, a large compartment for your daily essentials. That will put an end to organize disorder at home and on the go.

Gemibee UV Deluxe is made with classic vegan leather, comes with four natural color: Classic Black, Sunset Orange, Royal Blue and Joyful Pink.

  • Gemibee UV Deluxe Vanity Case

  • Gemibee UV Deluxe Cube

 

See how Gemibee UV Deluxe is created...

Concept initiated and product design in progress

 

Paper molding development for the UV box

 

Components for PC board

 

Dummy box for functional testing

 

Materials selection in process

Building up the 3rd prototype

 

Prototype Development

 

 

Gemibee Power bank is not included, it is an add-on item available for local delivery only.

It's classic and perfect— Designed to fit the contemporary, always on the go lifestyle!

What are you waiting for?  Let’s begin your germ-free journey with Gemibee!

www.gemibee.com

 

The Perks

 

Meet our team

In Nexus, we always show our motivation for exploring newness, a passion for better lifestyle, and a taste for the aesthetic intelligence to deliver the best products from exciting design, in good quality and innovation that truly adds value to our lives. 

Today we are happy to introduce the Gemibee UV Deluxe, hope you love it and support in this crowd-funding project.  We hope you enjoy using our Gemibee UV Deluxe as much as we enjoy making them!

Visit us at: www.nexus-global.com.hk

 

Safety Certificates

UVC sterilization report by CMA Hong Kong

 

FCC Supplier's Declaration of Conformity & RoHS certificates

 

Risks and challenges

Gemibee UV Deluxe collection is the idea about to combine technology and fashion. With no prior experience, the team did encounter some challenging tasks during product design and development stages.

The UVC sanitizer you find in market today are mostly with hard plastic case as they are easier for assembly during mass production.  From designing the latest fashion trends to integrating UVC light technology, there required practical layout for the electronic board and the sewing technique for a leather case.  All components are required to place in a very slim board and hide inside the case compartment so as to keep the perfect outlook of the product.  We have to make sure that our products are not only be good at sterilization and disinfection, but also safe and effective prodcts.

On top of that, the Gemibee UV Deluxe aims to give our end users the experience for not only a disinfection device, but also a perfect organizer to store their beauty essentials. When putting all these considerations together, we had created more than 5 designs and samplings, many measures and procedures were taken into trials for 6 months, we finally have it done successfully!

Hello,

My name is Bill. I am reaching out to you all for a little help. The reason i am asking is not so much for myself but for a person who is embedded in my heart...Samantha. Samantha is my long time partner and love of my life. Samantha is battling cancer for the last 4 years. I am her fulltime caregiver and at the moment we have very few resources to help in this fight. I am recently unemployed and unemployment has run out. Bills are mounting and Samanthas health is not improving. I am reluctantly asking you for some help. If things continue the way they are we will more than likely lose our home. My back is against the wall. I have sold what i can of my personal belongings to make ends meet. It is my hope that you can find it in your heart to help out in any way you can. Thank you and please share our story with your friends. my promise is to one day pay it forward and help others in need like us. Thank you.

story:
On August 4th at 11am, Your Medical Cannabis Headquarters was raided and the owner, Glenn Price, was arrested. During this wrongful arrest extreme Police and intimidation tactics were used. No warrant was shown nor declaration or intent was made by the Winnipeg Police as they stormed into the premises.

For more information on how Glenn was treated follow this CBC news article

http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/shop-own...

Alongside Glenn, his wife, a customer and one employee (who was not mentioned) were also detained. Glenn’s wife, the customer, and the employee were held at the Public Safety Building for several hours before being released with no charges

http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/local/Marijuan...

During the raid the Winnipeg Police confiscated all merchandise including, medicines, all forms of advertisement, office equipment, as well as a few personal belongings.

Now that Glenn is being charged with multiple offences including trafficking, he is in serious need of a top quality Cannabis defense lawyer, with the experience and knowledge to properly represent Glenn in his ongoing criminal proceedings.

A proper defense for Glenn does not come without it’s associated costs and due to Police actions Glenn has a very limited stream to support his defense. We are asking Cannabis supporters of all kinds, even those who aren’t Medical Cannabis users but believe in the medical benefits and what Glenn is trying to do, to donate and help keep the movement alive.

We appreciate and thank you for any support given!

Legalize Revolution!

story:
Justan's Story

Born in New Orleans in November of 1982. Justan Carlson has been drawing since he could pick up a crayon and draw on the walls. He started tattooing in June of 2004, professionally piercing a few months later and doing scarification around the same time. He was the first person to do scarification in the quad cities (iowa)  and chances are if you’ve seen someone with a branding in that area; he did it.

Justan specializes in zombie/horror art. His passion lies in all horror movies, southern culture and “braaaaaains”. Throughout his life so far; he’s lived everywhere but the east coast, he enjoyed Canada and New Orleans the most. Although he has type 1 diabetes, he doesn’t let that slow him down; much less allow it to be a hinderance in his natural born talents.

Residing currently in Denver, his diabetes has taken a very painful, and inconvenient turn for the worse. His teeth and gums have been severely attacked by the diabetes, and he needs to undergo a large amount of dental work in the very near future, to avoid any futher complications with his health. 12 extractions, 8 fillings, and partial dentures to be exact. 

However, this is not a stopping point for Justan, this is merely a bump in the road. Hope is set high, and this will not stop him. 

Thanks for your time and your support! If you are unable to help donate, you can still help us by spreading the word! 

 

To view examples of the artists work, visit www.deadfishtattoo.com or on facebook at www.facebook.com/mydeadfish

story:
Who am I?

My name is Juliet, or Julz for short. I’m a 38 year old transwoman or male-to-female  transgender individual. As an teen, I wanted so badly to look like women I saw on television and my friends in high school. I hated myself for not having the body that I wanted, for instead having a body that didn’t even feel like mine. As I grew older, I thought I could learn to accept that this was the body I was given and it’s the only one I’m going to get. So no matter what, I’m going to try to make the best of it in any way I can. This didn’t work out as well as I had planned.

My transition

It’s hard to look in the mirror and not recognize the body that you see. It’s depressing  and demoralizing. Thankfully we live in modern times and there are options available for girls like me. I started HRT 2 years ago and the changes have been fantastic. Little by little each day, I move closer to my ideal. I can’t describe how wonderful it is to see myself becoming the woman I have longed to be. But each day, I see my chest, and although there has been minimal growth, knowing that my body is still wrong in a rush of sadness, alienation, and anxiety. So daily I wear padding to mimic full breast and no low cut shirts. This causes me to suffer the side effects of sweat rashes, heat blisters, and daily irritation.

My family, while in the past being supportive of the choices I made, when I came out to them, they didn’t  really support me at all,since then they have made some progress to accepting me for who I am,but not much more, but time will tell the future . My decision to get surgery or any kind of medical intervention involving my gender, was solely on me, so I am financially on my own. I would not be able to afford the hormone treatments if it wasn’t for the care of the VA directive that was released in 2011 covering the treatment of transgendered veterans. Only then was I able to afford the meds needed.I have also been in therapy for some time and can provide the required letter of recommendation, saying that “transgender surgery is the next step in the transition process”, a qualification also provided by the Trans Standards of Care (WPATH).

For me, top surgery represents the biggest joy I can imagine, starting from when I was entering puberty. After years of research, advice, and self-reflection, I’ve made the final decision to pursue top surgery. At the end of the procedure, I will have a well-developed female chest. But the most valuable part of the surgery is that I will finally feel at home in my own body. All I want is to be happy and this is the key to it. And I will be the happiest low-cut shirt wearing woman you’ve ever seen.

So I am humbly asking for your help and support to make this possible, to make my dream a reality, and bringing me one step closer to being myself.

 

I need your help!

Top surgery is very expensive, especially for a young woman  that has returned to college attempting to make her way in the world. I’m currently a CNA and have applied for the nursing program, but the pay as a CNA is dismal and most of it goes to pay for rent, bills, food, so that I can survive. In this situation, it’s very difficult to find the money to put away for something that will help me thrive.

 

 

 

This seems like an insurmountable cost, but no amount is to small or too great. Every donation is a little piece of joy, a smile just for you, knowing I am one step closer to my dream, my one hope, becoming a reality.

Even if you can’t personally contribute,  please pass the word along. Send this to your friends and neighbors and allies. Because this surgery will literally change my life. For the first time, I will be able to feel my body and not feel dysphoria and pain; there will only be joy, happiness, and possibility. And that truly is the greatest gift of all.

 

Questions?


I know some of you might have questions for me before you decide to donate. Its not an easy desicion to donate and have some thought in your head you would like to have answered. So, I am going to give you a way to ask me your question before you donate if you want. You can email me at blazindizzy@juno.com. I will try to respond to your questions in reasonable time.

Again, thank you to all involved!

story:
It's time for Team Obama's 7th annual Day Before Thanksgiving feast at the Access Center, a shelter in Santa Monica! 

We'll be feeding 250 folks fresh, locally grown, chef prepared veggies and sides thanks to the incomparable Chef Cordelia, along with turkeys cooked in the homes of our team members. We need to raise $800 to cover the fixins for the green beans, mashed taters, stuffing and gravy. In addition, pre cooked, store bought turkeys are $50 for a 10-12lber and we'll need to buy a few of those to make up for what we can't fit in our ovens. Any money raised above and beyond what's needed for the meal will be donated to the Access Center.

If you'd like to donate food instead of money, or sign up to help prep, cook or serve, please fill out this google form. There will be shifts on Monday 11/23 and Wednesday 11/25 for those looking to pitch in.

Thanks for doing what you can!

With gratitude,

Angelina Burnett

story:
Amigos del mundo!! yo como muchos tengo la fortuna de conocer y tener en mi vida y de mis hijos a un ser humano excepcional, se llama Carlos Adrian y tiene 21 años es una persona con un corazón enorme, noble y bondadoso, con sueños y aspiraciones por delante que con mucho esfuerzo a logrado ser un estudiante ejemplar, y con toda una vida por delante....desafortunadamente se le diagnóstico una enfermedad de la sangre;  Aquí les dejo sus palabras:

Hola, mi nombre es Carlos Adrián Ortiz de Montellano Soto, desde hace 11 meses me diagnosticaron una enfermedad muy rara llamada Anemia Aplasica muy severa, cuando me dijeron mi diagnóstico nunca imagine la gravedad de mi problema, ya que en pocas palabras es como Leucemia debido a que mi médula ósea dejó de producir glóbulos rojos, glóbulos blancos y plaquetas. Después de varias pruebas con medicamentos que no dieron resultado me dijeron que mi mejor y casi única opción era el trasplante de médula ósea.

Acudí a la Fundación Comparte Vida A.C. que se destaca en promover la donación altruista de médula ósea en todo el país, además cuenta con los registros internacionales de donadores, ellos me tomaron una muestra de sangre para sacar mi código genético y compararlo con los donadores. En caso de ser compatible la fundación se encarga de transportar el órgano e importarlo en caso de ser un donador de otro país. Hace unos días me dieron la grandiosa noticia de que encontraron a un donador de médula ósea genéticamente compatible conmigo, lo cual es casi un milagro ya que las posibilidades son de una en un millón o a veces hasta más.

El siguiente paso es recaudar fondos ya que transportar el órgano e importarlo cuesta cuarenta y siete mil dólares ($47,000.00 USD) más los gastos hospitalarios y medicamentos que pueden llegar a costar alrededor de cien mil dólares (100,000.00 DLS) aproximadamente. Desafortunadamente no cuento con dichas cantidades debido a que desde mi diagnostico hemos tenido gastos bastante fuertes en cuanto a los medicamentos experimentales para encontrar la cura a mi enfermedad, por otro lado, el tiempo lo tengo encima así que acudo a ustedes rogándoles si pueden donar la cantidad que ustedes consideren, o cualquier otra aportación que sea de ayuda. Les agradecere infinitamente si pueden difundir,o con todas las personas posibles. Muchisimas muchisisimas gracias. 


Así que con todas las pilas del mundo, iniciamos una carrera para reunir fondos y así Carlos Adrian logre cumplir todas su metas y sueños, Hágamoslo realidad!

Lo que necesitamos:


  • Hoy necesitamos de tu ayuda, para lograr reunir aproximadamente $47,000.00 dls, el cual consta del traslado del órgano a donar, el transplante, gastos de hospitalización y $100,000.000 restantes para el tratamiento posterior al transplante, medicamentos que son muy costosos, cuidados y rehabilitación.
  • Conforme se desarrolle la campaña iremos ofreciendo recompensas para animarte a donar, pero que mejor recompensa que dar vida. 
  • Los fondos que se logren reunir posteriormente se conducirán a la fundación Comparte Vida A.C para ayudar a más personas que sufren este padecimiento.

La magnitud de esta campaña y el impacto tu donación es convertirte en el amigo secreto de por vida de Carlos Adrián, sino puedes realizar donaciones económicas también puedes donar médula ósea para que otros tengan la misma oportunidad de igual forma hacer eco sobre este fondeo, puedes hacer uso de las herramientas que indiegoo proporciona.
story_txt:
Amigos del mundo!! yo como muchos tengo la fortuna de conocer y tener en mi vida y de mis hijos a un ser humano excepcional, se llama Carlos Adrian y tiene 21 años es una persona con un corazón enorme, noble y bondadoso, con sueños y aspiraciones por delante que con mucho esfuerzo a logrado ser un estudiante ejemplar, y con toda una vida por delante....desafortunadamente se le diagnóstico una enfermedad de la sangre;  Aquí les dejo sus palabras:


Hola, mi nombre es Carlos Adrián Ortiz de Montellano Soto, desde hace 11 meses me diagnosticaron una enfermedad muy rara llamada Anemia Aplasica muy severa, cuando me dijeron mi diagnóstico nunca imagine la gravedad de mi problema, ya que en pocas palabras es como Leucemia debido a que mi médula ósea dejó de producir glóbulos rojos, glóbulos blancos y plaquetas. Después de varias pruebas con medicamentos que no dieron resultado me dijeron que mi mejor y casi única opción era el trasplante de médula ósea.

Acudí a la Fundación Comparte Vida A.C. que se destaca en promover la donación altruista de médula ósea en todo el país, además cuenta con los registros internacionales de donadores, ellos me tomaron una muestra de sangre para sacar mi código genético y compararlo con los donadores. En caso de ser compatible la fundación se encarga de transportar el órgano e importarlo en caso de ser un donador de otro país. Hace unos días me dieron la grandiosa noticia de que encontraron a un donador de médula ósea genéticamente compatible conmigo, lo cual es casi un milagro ya que las posibilidades son de una en un millón o a veces hasta más.
El siguiente paso es recaudar fondos ya que transportar el órgano e importarlo cuesta cuarenta y siete mil dólares ($47,000.00 USD) más los gastos hospitalarios y medicamentos que pueden llegar a costar alrededor de cien mil dólares (100,000.00 DLS) aproximadamente. Desafortunadamente no cuento con dichas cantidades debido a que desde mi diagnostico hemos tenido gastos bastante fuertes en cuanto a los medicamentos experimentales para encontrar la cura a mi enfermedad, por otro lado, el tiempo lo tengo encima así que acudo a ustedes rogándoles si pueden donar la cantidad que ustedes consideren, o cualquier otra aportación que sea de ayuda. Les agradecere infinitamente si pueden difundir,o con todas las personas posibles. Muchisimas muchisisimas gracias. 

Así que con todas las pilas del mundo, iniciamos una carrera para reunir fondos y así Carlos Adrian logre cumplir todas su metas y sueños, Hágamoslo realidad!   Lo que necesitamos:  
Hoy necesitamos de tu ayuda, para lograr reunir aproximadamente $47,000.00 dls, el cual consta del traslado del órgano a donar, el transplante, gastos de hospitalización y $100,000.000 restantes para el tratamiento posterior al transplante, medicamentos que son muy costosos, cuidados y rehabilitación. Conforme se desarrolle la campaña iremos ofreciendo recompensas para animarte a donar, pero que mejor recompensa que dar vida.  Los fondos que se logren reunir posteriormente se conducirán a la fundación Comparte Vida A.C para ayudar a más personas que sufren este padecimiento.

 La magnitud de esta campaña y el impacto tu donación es convertirte en el amigo secreto de por vida de Carlos Adrián, sino puedes realizar donaciones económicas también puedes donar médula ósea para que otros tengan la misma oportunidad de igual forma hacer eco sobre este fondeo, puedes hacer uso de las herramientas que indiegoo proporciona.

story:
Hi, it's Ryno! And it's surgery time. Woooot.

Many of you know me already, some don't (hopefully), but regardless - it's time for my top surgery. After 6+ years of binding my breasts I'm ready to feel sun and air on my skin again and to leave the chest binding behind. I've patiently tolerated wearing two shirts during hot Arizona summers, having sweat roll down my back, and not being able to wear many shirts I like because they're "too revealing".

I scheduled my surgery for late-mid October...yes! As the days count down I'm imagining what it will be like to feel a shirt, and just a shirt, directly on my skin. I'll be having surgery in Florida and it will be performed by Dr. Charles Garramone. He tries to keep the fees reasonable but because insuranace companies see this surgery as cosmetic and not necessary, it must be paid for out of pocket. This includes the surgery fee, surgery center, meds, rental car, hotel, time off from work and food while away so I need  some help paying for all of this. 

It's difficult for me to ask others to help but I believe it's necessary and that in the end I'll be happy that I did. Anything that can be contributed helps greatly.

Here's a breakdown of the various expenses:

Surgeon: $6,000

Surgery Center: $1,300+

Rental Car (including fees and gas) : $500-$600

Hotel: $750

Meds/Necessary post-surgery items: $125.00

Food while in Florida: $400


**All needed funds will go to expenses and anything additional I'll donate to another person.


I've donated both time and money to funding others' surgeries and am ready to go myself. I knew I would know when it was time because I wasn't ready in the beginning. It's been important to me to spend some time with my body and not make an irreversible change before I am ready. The time has come. :)

I know that the reality is that sometimes we can't contribute financially and I completely understand - I've been there. But any and all help is wanted and appreciated. If you're able to forward this to others that might be interested in donating you'll have my undying love.

Thank you so much,

-Ryan

story:
This is Hawaii's chance to help medical marijuana patients.

While Mike Ruggles is facing 77 years in prison, this is an opportunity to set precedence for medical marijuana collectives in Hawaii. Please help with legal fees- your donation will:


Your donation will:

  1. Help set legal precedence for medical cannabis collectives in Hawaii. 

  2. Save an innocent and cherished father, grandfather, uncle, brother, friend, and local freedom fighter from 77 years in prison.

  3. Make a statement that medical cannabis patients are not a danger to society and do not deserve to die in prison.

If you suffer from chronic pain or a debilitating condition and have experienced how cannabis betters your quality of life- this fight is for you.
Click the "donate" button to donate anonymously or add your name.


Our Story

Mike Ruggles is a well-known Big Island medical cannabis activist and patient. He is known for his charismatic, funny, down-to-earth, kind and generous nature. He’s mentored 100’s of people on  their rights, and how to legally get started, safely cultivate, process, and consume cannabis in its various forms to best suit their needs.


This last January, Mike noticed the definition of “medical use” in Hawaii’s medical marijuana law has been changed to now allow medical cannabis patients to transfer medicine between each other. Combined with State and Federal laws on controlled substances, he saw a legal opportunity to start a collective for patients to help each other. Mike contacted over 20 government agencies from the Attorney General’s Office to various  related offices to inquire this law change. Not one agency denied the legality.

So, he opened the Alternative Pain Management Pu`uhonua LLC Collective and modeled it after legally successful collectives in California. “Pu’uhonua” translates to “place of refuge.” In just 9 months, hundreds of medical marijuana patients joined, with the majority being over 50 years of age, including hospice patients and veterans. Not only was membership free, but patients had  variety of medical resources. The collective was a success.


Despite the fact that the collective (1) legal, (2) paid taxes, and (3) clearly benefited the community, on September 10th the collective was raided by Hawaii police, (who are publicly opposed to the Hawaii's medical cannabis program) and Mike was arrested. Not only were terminally ill patients’ medicine seized, Mike is being wrongly charged with running a “dispensary” and is now facing 77 years in prison- a life sentence. Mike is a father of four and grandfather of five. He needs a good attorney.

It's been 15 years since Hawaii's medical marijuana program started. It's time for law enforcement to support the legal right for patients to acquire the medications recommended by their doctor. Though legal, for 15 years patients have been dangerously forced to purchase their medicine from the black market. It's time for change.

If you agree that:

  • It's reasonable that medical marijuana patients be able to acquire medicine through a Collective.
  • Mike doesn't deserve a life sentence.
  • Patients shouldn't have to wait so that only 2 dispensaries can monopolize and somehow serve our over 5,000 Big Island medical marijuana patients and charge whatever the want.

Please consider making a donation now. If a thousand people donate $10, that's a critical $10,000 toward the cause.

By donating you aren’t just keeping Mike out of prison, you're helping to set precedence for the collective model statewide.

All funds will go directly to the Save Ruggles legal fund. Unfortunately, good attorney's are expensive and it's going to take one of the best to WIN this.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • SHARE!!! Share to Facebook, Tweet, and EMAIL the link to your friends. Together, our networks can WIN this!

  • Write a few paragraphs to the editor to West Hawaii Today, The Tribune Herald, and Star Advertiser on why you support Mike and the Collective.

  • Write to the Honorable Judge Nakamura in support of Mike Ruggles at 777 Kilauea Ave., Hilo, HI 96720.

  • Attend the trial. Trial begins on February 16th, a large crowd shows the jury that people care and are watching.

Thank you for your support, every little bit counts. We will keep you posted.
Sincerely,
Mike and the Save Ruggles Team

story:
FANIGHT IS THE FIRST AND ONLY LIGHT-UP JACKET THAT RECHARGES ITSELF WITH LIGHT.

FANIGHT lets you enjoy the nighttime with confidence and comfort. With exclusive RE NANO technology applied, it absorbs harmful UV light in the day and converts it into beautiful light emitted at night. Laser-cut reflective strips, ultra fast drying fabric, unbeatable breathability of it make your athletic performance as amazing as your brightness.

 

12 FEATURES FOR BOTH DAY AND NIGHT.

 

 

Beautiful movement.

Turn your every motion into a luminous work of art. Perfect for exercising at night, street dancing and more, the bright light FANIGHT emits makes movements visible to your audience.

 

Shine like a star.

When you go out, make sure you stand out. Whether you’re dancing in a dark club, skateboarding in the streets, or just playing a game with your friends in a field, you will be the star of the show.

 

Safety in different environments.

 

A Dream for Cyclists and Runners.

Stay visible, warm, and dry. FANIGHT offers everything that an avid cyclist or runner would want from a jacket.

 

Soggy active clothes are a thing of the past. FANIGHT is made with breathable fabric and butterfly mesh wick that keep sweat away from the body.  Users will feel nice and dry even after a workout on a hot summer day. FANIGHT has breathable mesh under the armpits and on the back, minimizing heat to solve the problem of sweat. 

 

Exercise and play without any resistance for your very best performance. With the perfect amount of elasticity, you won’t feel constrained, but your jacket will still fit perfectly.  20D ultra light fabric, woven with spandex, offers wearers a smooth and incredibly comfortable feel.

 

The jacket wicks moisture to the surface, so even when you work up a sweat you feel dry and comfortable. The technology is so effective that even if you’re running next to the ocean or in a drizzle, your clothes will dry within seconds.

 

Defend yourself from harmful UV light. The environmentally-friendly fibers in the RE NANO fabric form a protective layer on top of your clothes to absorb harmful rays.

 

Storm cuffs keep you warm and cozy even on cold, windy nights. Thumb holes in the cuffs keep your sleeves secure.

 

FANIGHT folds down so small that it can fit in the palm of your hand, so you can take it with you when shopping, traveling, or doing any outdoor activity.

 

 

The exclusive technology of RE NANO™.

RE NANO™ fabric absorbs and stores the energy of UV light during the day, and then releases it at night as cold light. This process creates light without polluting the environment or producing any radiation. Conveniently, this innovative fabric is also breathable and comfortable.

 

FANIGHT is powered by absorbing all wavelengths of visible light. It only requires 20 minutes of exposure to light to work, and it will emit light for up to two hours. Any light source works, including UV light, incandescent light, fluorescent light, etc.

 

To make sure we provide our customers the very best materials and accessories, we only choose top-notch clothing brand manufacturers and suppliers. FANIGHT has passed SGS, ISO, and EN safety tests and standards.

 

Luminescent material comparison table.

 

Rico Lee

Rico has been designing clothes in the fashion industry for 15 years. Since he started working in the outdoor gear world in 2009, he’s worked at NORTHLAND and ACOME, serving as head design director and head innovation director. He has been recognized for excellence by the International Society for Prosthetics and Orthotics.

 

 

 

FANIGHT’s sleek air flow design shows off your physique day or night.

 

Exchange policy:

The jacket shall fit you fine if following the sizing chart. We accept exchange with shipping fees covered by the backer. No returns please since we are a start-up company and the marginal profits on Indiegogo. 

 

 

 

FANIGHT is comprised of research scientists, fashion designers, fitness enthusiasts and merchandising experts working together to create sports apparel that showcases the best in technology, art and green living. We strive to create the most amazing sports apparel that is technically and aesthetically superior to anything else on the market. We want every piece of work made by FANIGHT to be surprising, interesting, useful, and completely unique.

 

If FANIGHT didn’t achieve its crowdfunding goal, would we get the product?
Yes. Even if FANIGHT does not achieve its crowdfunding goal, we would still deliver the jacket to every backer. We are grateful for everyone who has faith in us. Moreover, we have 100% confidence that FANIGHT will be in mass production, so there is no need to worry about it. 

 

Shipping Questions
When can I expect it to be shipped?
Because of the high level of technology, the shortest cycle to produce a batch of FANIGHT would be three months. We are trying our best to speed up the process so that you can receive it earlier. The first batch of FANIGHT for campaign backers is expected to ship around February 2017. We will keep the campaign contributors updated with our progress on a regular basis. 

 

How much does the package weigh? 

FANIGHT: 7.05oz (200g)
Packaging: 0.71oz (20g) 

 

Are there any countries you cannot ship to?
Yes, unfortunately, we are not able to ship to Croatia, Iraq and Guadeloupe. 

 

How to pick the color and size?
At the end of the crowdfunding campaign, we will send out a survey to all the backers for the choices of size and color. You can put in your complete information and preference. Please note that there is no pink option for men. 

 

Can you machine dry it? How does washing it in a machine affect the cloth? Anything we need to pay extra attention to?
Please use low heat when machine drying. We suggest not using hot water to wash with either. 86°F would be a good temperature. After washing the jacket 15-20 times, the fluorescent effect will start to wear off. We expect the fluorescent effect to last about 3 years. 

 

Is it water resistant? Does it protect UV light?
Yes. FANIGHT uses waterproof material that also absorbs UV light. 

 

REFUND POLICY

You can initiate 100% refunds within the first 8 days of backing an Indiegogo campaign by going to your contributions tab on the Indiegogo page.

 

RETURN AND EXCHANGE POLICY

Please note all sales are final. Contributing to a campaign and claiming a perk on Indiegogo is not the same as buying a product online. There will be no exchanges or returns for change of mind. If you have a factory defect, please email the Customer Happiness Team on support@itiwant.us to arrange an assessment and replacement if deemed defective.

story: After working 20yrs in jobs unrelated to my true calling I have finally figured it out. I am most happy when I'm being part of a solution rather than trying to make as much money as I can. In 2010 I started volunteering for the Haiti recovery efforts ( www.agoldenhour4all.org ). Shortly there after I was employed by the organization. For 3.5 years I worked as a Project Manager. After this project was over for me I thought I'd continue my efforts in Non Profits. Since then, I've been trying to figure out ways I can still help between projects, and I have tons of ideas. I am on the verge of launching my own Non Profit this summer, but in the meantime, I have been working and helping local and international Non Profits on a voluntary basis. Thank you for taking a moment to consider helping those in need, even if it's not my cause you support. YOU are the solution and we ALL need to work together to help our neighbors, near AND far.
