story:
* S A P F O F E S T * - * F I R S T * Q U E E R * F E S T I V A L * I N * B A L T I C S*

This year – for the 4th time now – SapfoFest returns on 17- 19th July 2015 @ Žeimiai Manor House (Jonava district, Lithuania) determined to improve and succeed in acting together! SapfoFest is the first totally free and independent community-initiated Festival in the Baltics, which seeks to connect and empower the queer community, fight prejudice and discrimination, as well as increase awareness and visibility of queers in Lithuania and the rest of Eastern Europe. Even without any major institutional support, for the 4th time this year SapfoFest is growing and expanding through volunteering, services in-kind, crowd funding and in-kind donations. A lot of determination by its organizers, volunteers and increasing number of participants (2012 – 70; 2013 – 100; ir 2014 – 200) have succeeded in creating a learning, sharing, empowering space for queer and LGBT+ community & allies in Lithuania and the Baltics. Through powerful tools of education, culture & knowledge sharing we seek to mobilize our resources and capacity that are necessary to bring social change and create the society of the future!


* S A P F O F E S T  * G O A L S * 

The annual free-of-charge Festival seeks to:

• raise awareness of sexual and gender inequalities both within the queer community itself and beyond in Lithuania and the rest of Eastern Europe; 

• educate the queer community and its allies by designing an ambitious educational and cultural program of the Festival;

• empower & connect the queer community members & their allies by creating a shared space;

• increase social inclusion via joint artistic and sporting activities;

• provide access to community resources for the individuals that are in need;

• create a stable platform for the queer community building, networking and knowledge exchange. 


* S A P F O F E S T  * O U T P U T S : * C O N T E N T S * &  * A C T I V I T I E S*

For the fourth year in a row the Festival will be strengthening ties among the queer community members by bringing people together into a shared space and providing knowledge on queer and LGBT+ issues internationally and in Lithuania. SapfoFest has a broad educational, cultural as well as arts and sports programme that extends over 3 days from 17th to 19th July. The programme is divided into six types of activity: 

SapfoEdu  is  the educational segment of the programme which includes a wide range of lectures and workshops. The purpose of this part of the programme is to provide a platform supporting the exchange of ideas, information, activist strategies related to queer and LGBT+ rights, discourse and problems. Educational activities are crucial for our own development as individuals and community  and are a prerequisite for social change.


SapfoArt is the cultural part of the programme that consists of music, photography and mixed media events, painting exhibitions, creative writing workshops and poetry readings. The aim of this programme is to provide a platform supporting arts and culture as a method for working with queer and LGBT+ rightsand issues. The programme aims at creating the exchange of new ideas, activist and cultural strategies that are at the core of social change. Famous queer artists and well known activists will join SapfoArt.

SapfoFilm features film screenings and related discussions of interest. This programme will provide a platform for exploring, celebrating and advancing queer and LGBT+ communities through the expression of cinema, and it will tackle a wide range of social, political and economic issues. 


SapfoSport  consists of a variety of sporting activities. SapfoSport will unite, strengthen and connect the queer and LGBT+ community members through increasing participation in sports and mutual respect for one another, and will aim to tackle social and economical exclusion.

SapfoDisco is all about nightlife and having fun together. Live music, karaoke and the dance floor will provide a Festive ambience to meet and connect the queer community members and their allies.  

SapfoSpecials. From sex workshops to dating platforms. This part of the programme changes annually in order to develop new ways we can enrich and make our sexual lives safer as well as more satisfying. In the Lithuanian context taboo breaking is critical. 




* I M P A C T * O F * S A P F O F E S T  * 

The diverse Festival programme and shared community space will lead to:
·  increased awareness & knowledge within the target audience (the queer and LGBT+ community & allies, especially among the new members) and their resulting familiarity with relevant LGBT+ issues, queer movement, rights and the legal  context at the national, regional and international level;
·  social inclusion & cohesion. The target audience will have a better access to the queer and LGBT+ community support & shared resources, such as legal advice or support in case of verbal or physical abuse);
· building a strong community and opening-up opportunities for future collaborations;
·  increased visibility and representation of the queer and LGBT+ communities and queer women in particular, beyond the community itself: via mass-media on political and public level, necessary for a social change.

We invite You to support the SapfoFest 2015 and make these goals a reality!



* W H A T * Y O U R * S U P P O R T * W I L L * B E * U S E D* F O R*?   

All events at the Festival are free - we believe that non-discriminatory behaviour should also be free of economic exclusion.  Those willing to contribute may do so; and those who cannot should not be precluded from participating. Your contributions will help to cover the costs of organizing the SapfoFest 2015 programme, and will contribute to the direct costs such as transportation, stage construction and venue costs, including electricity and utilities, as well as some financial support for Zeimiai Manor House  and programme participants. The funds raised from this crowdfunding campaign will allow us to increase the quality of the Festival outputs, and to provide for financial contributions for:


1.  *S Y N A E S T H E S I S* - contemporary music ensemble - agreed to perform at the SapfoFest 2015, and we would like to support the work and potential of these young brave and ambitious musicians!

* S Y N A E S T H E S I S* is an organism, and experiment, that differentiates itself from the pure practice of music. The name * S Y N A E S T H E S I S* refers to the poorly understood phenomenon of synesthetics – an uncontrollable mix of emotions with the world of feelings: sound, colour and odour. * S Y N A E S T H E S I S* can turn music into a blue-ish dot, pain into a ringing in your head, perfume to melody. While searching for the most interesting approaches to this, the musicians in * S Y N A E S T H E S I S* try to find new ways to turn contemporary experimental music not only in to something more meaningful, but also into a tradition that takes its roots in Lithuania. 

This team of young, brave and ambitious musicians has taken up the mission of introducing experimental Lithuanian and foreign composer works to big concert halls. The cast of the ensemble, which can sound as frightening and grand as a rock band or a small chamber orchestra, creates a widely and creatively exploited sound field, which reveals a kind of collective universality that can be equated to the origins of music itself.


2. * P L A N N I N G T O R O C K *

In cooperation with Goethe Institut Vilnius, we are thrilled to have these amazing artists with us! While Goethe Institut will partially cover their fees (Goethe provides 1500 EUR), we still need to cover the rest to make it happen: (the total fee is 3000 EUR) plus flights, costs of  technical equipment, stage, lighting, local transport and accommodation, as well as local hospitality:) 


3. * C L A S S I C A L * M U S I C * T R I O * T H I R T Y * F I N G E R S * -   will create an opportunity to enjoy some classical music. 

Members of * T H I R T Y * F I N G E R S * - Marta Finkelštein (piano), Lora Kmieliauskaitė (violin) ir Arnas Kmieliauskas (cello) - are accomplished students of Academy of Music, they are laureates of International competitions and participants of various festivals. Recently they won a prize for ,,Creative outburst" in Chamber Music Competition in Vilnius. This summer * T H I R T Y * F I N G E R S*  will represent Lithuania in prestigious Isa Chamber Music Masterclasses in Austria. We are very grateful for  * T H I R T Y * F I N G E R S * T R I O* for agreeing to play at SapfoFest 2015, and would like to support their work - we believe it is a future of the worldwide classical music scene! 


4. *Š O K I A I* S U* S I M A* I R* S A L N E* - a Lithuanian DJ duo, whom we are so proud to have at the SapfoFest 2015! Sima and Šalnė accepted to play and make crowds dance at the SapfoFest 2015, and we would like to support their work! Every contribution makes a difference! 




In order to support these amazing artists, we need Your help! If You have means, please contribute and help to make it happen! 


* O T H E R * W A Y S * Y O U * C A N * H E L P*  S A P F O F E S T  * 

Some people just can't contribute with donations and its ok, but that doesn't mean You can't help SapfoFest:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about SapfoFest campaign! 
  • Share our Indiegogo platform with Your friends, colleagues, families, friends and strangers!


* U S E F U L * L I N K S* 


Visit SapfoFest website: http://www.sapfofest.org/

Like SapfoFest on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sapfofest

Attend the Festival: https://www.facebook.com/events/1618091441745182/

To find out more about the projects and activities of Žeimiai Manor House, visit:

http://www.zeimiudvaras.lt/; 

http://futurizmas.zeimiudvaras.lt/;

 http://stolenindex.tumblr.com/;

 http://residencyoyo.zeimiudvaras.lt/.

story:
Ellibelli has raised her grandson from birth he,s 15Yrs Old, now and Ellibelli wants to make memories for him. She has managed to take him to the London Eye and The Harry Potter Museum, and wants to take him to Paris Disney before she dies,

Elliebelli,s only wish for herself is to see the Jersey Boys in concert. Ellibelli needs funds for these 2 things so PLEASE PLEASE donate to make my friends BUCKET WISH LIST AND MAKE HER WISH COME TRUE

story:
Dear Friends,

As many of you know I am still waiting for MSF-Doctors Without Borders to send me somewhere on my actual assignment.

Rather than do more locums (temp doctor work) in places that I'm not too fond of - I decided to go back to Haiti to volunteer for November and December.

Interestingly they want to me to teach the medical students/general docs some Ophthalmology while I am there (yes, even though I changed fields!).
In addition to bringing some medication donations, I thought it would be nice to leave some ophthalmoscopes behind so they can actually use them for eye exams...

Please help me raise some funds to purchase the supplies.
Estimates:
Ophthalmoscopes $450 each
Medications $500

I will be of course paying my own airfare / travel insurance etc. I plan to use 100% of your contributions (minus whatever indiegogo takes) and put it towards the actual supplies.

Obviously Haiti faces many ongoing challenges including food security, housing, clean water, and healthcare. Their problems only became amplified with the earthquake 2 years ago.

Thanks very much for caring! Every contribution matters to somebody!

cheers,
Varun

varun8@gmail.com
917-791-1007

story:
Our Story

Innovation: Africa's mission is simple: we bring solar and agricultural technologies from Israel to Africa. Since 2008, we've completed 63 solar projects alone. These are solar powered schools for students and adults to study in the evening; medical clinics for emergency nighttime care and refrigeration of lifesaving vaccines; and water pumps for providing clean water to communities in need. 

Innovation: Africa used to be known as Jewish Heart for Africa. Why the change? Learn more here.

 

What We've Done So Far

So far, our projects serve 454,422 people, but there are so many more who need us.

Last Hanukkah, in just 8 days, we raised $8,498 to bring light to Sapiri Medical Center in Uganda. We gave them electricity in their inpatient ward to treat patients at night. They no longer use dangerous kerosene lamps for night time procedures, and they have a refrigerator in which to store lifesaving medicines and vaccines. For the first time, the 7,890 residents of Sapiri Village have access to the medical care they deserve.

Click here to learn more about the impact of last year's campaign.  

One year later, the number of patients visiting Sapiri each night has doubled and the number of women coming in to give birth has tripled. They are running out of space.

They also have a primary school nearby. It serves 1,400 children -- 636 boys and 764 girls. Nearly 300 are orphans, mostly due to AIDS. These 1,400 children have no place to study after the sun sets. Most cannot even afford candles or kerosene lamps in their homes. And for those who can, they risk fire, eye strain and lung disease, all just to study after the sun goes down. 

 

Why We Need Your Help

With $10,000, we will go back to Sapiri Village to do two things:

1. We will extend the solar energy we installed last year at Sapiri Medical Center's inpatient ward to a second building nearby, the outpatient wing. With light in a second building, there will be plenty of space for all the new patients coming in at night since the installation of solar energy. We will also give them power for a laboratory with a microscope that will allow the doctors to diagnose diseases like malaria and tuberculosis. Diagnosing and treating these diseases earlier means that patients will receive the care they need sooner, and will increase their chances for a full recovery. 

2. We will power Sapiri Primary School, providing students with a place to study and learn at night. The teachers have already offered to stay late and teach evening classes. The 1,400 students will have a safe place to study without risking their eyesight and lungs, and will have the opportunity to work towards the brighter future they want for themselves. 

We don't have much time. Hanukkah is only 8 days long. But with your help, we can use this week long holiday to bring light to those who live without it. And for the people of Sapiri Village, every day will be a Festival of Lights. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can run a campaign of your own, donate your birthday, volunteer, spread the word...the opportunities are endless! If you're interested in getting involved, visit our volunteer page.

story:
"Life isn't about finding yourself, it's about creating yourself." - George Bernard Shaw

Who am I?

My name is Emmett Jack.  I am a trans man, which means I was identified as female at birth but have since realized that the life I am meant to live is that of a male-identified person.  The transition process itself is lengthy and expensive and unfortunately insurance companies do not cover the majority of costs.  This is only the beginning of my journey but having top surgery is a major step forward.

Any size donation that you give will help me alleviate the daily stress and anxiety that I live with.  Your contribution is not only an amount of money, but rather it is a piece of the puzzle that I need to create the physical being that I will feel safe and comfortable living in.  

Trans people face a daily battle with dysphoria, specifically surrounding our bodies.  I am no stranger to this.  Before I started hormone therapy, I felt a disconnection with the world 100% of the time.  I did not exist physically, the way that I wanted to and it kept me at a distance from the things and people I love.  Having been on hormones for only a short period of time, I can say that this is without a doubt the right path for me.  I am feeling better than I ever have and each day continues to provide me with reassurance and excitement.  Having top surgery is not something I want to do, it is something I NEED TO DO, in order to live the fullest, happiest and most complete life that I can.

Without top surgery, I am forced to wear a binder to give my chest a more masculine appearance, which is extremely uncomfortable.  It makes it hard to breathe and causes back pain when worn for too long but it is more vital and important for me to physically appear male and pass in the outside world than to endure these pains for the time being, knowing that one day my chest will match who I feel to be.  Being able to have this surgery before enduring another summer with a chest I do not feel fits my gender identity would be nothing short of a miracle.  I am not able to physically express myself the way I would like.

What I Need & What You Get

The cost of the double incision top surgery is $6500 with Dr. Garramone in Florida. Dr. Garramone is the current World’s Surgical Authority on FTM Top Surgery (Female To Male Transgender Chest Surgery). His practice serves an international clientele, and is focused primarily on Transgender Sexual Reassignment Surgery and Gender Confirmation Surgery.

http://drgarramone.com/blog/costs/

In addition to that, there is the cost of airfare for two (myself and my mom), from New York to Florida, $600, as well as a hotel stay for a week, $1200, as you are required to do a follow-up visit one week after surgery.

There are some great perks, all very personal. Check them out on the side.

Even if I don't reach my goal, the money will be put into savings to be used for the surgery as soon as I am able to acquire the balance.  All my savings are going into this as well and I will be working hard to come up with whatever balance I need to to get the surgery done as soon as I possibly can.

Why Should I Give You Money?

By contributing to this, you will know that you have forever changed my life and have been a part of my personal well-being.  You will be helping me live the life I am meant to live and to be the person who I know myself to be.  I already count myself lucky to have so many amazing people in my life, without which, I would not have the courage or confidence to embark on this life-changing journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money to spare right now, that's completely understandable.  All I ask is that you spread the word and ask people you know who you think might be able to help me reach my goal.

story:
Welcome to the campaign for my brother Curt Griffin, he is a strong person with so much passion for life.  I should mention that Curt is my brother-in-law, but he is family not an in-law.  My name is Patricia Griffin, I joined the family some 18 years ago and I immediately gained a second family.  Curt has been like a real brother to me, helping me and my family in every way possible.  I have never been able to repay his generosity and now I find myself having to sit back and watch as he struggles to make ends meet.  I couldn’t do it……I have to do something, so here I am begging and pleading for your HELP!

Curt has just finished an 8 week round of chemo and radiation treatment, it hit him hard this time.  He is only just now able to keep solid food down and is still fighting serious fatigue and a coughing fit every time he talks.  This is his second fight with cancer, the first just two years ago.  This time it is lung cancer, a mass on a bronchial tube.  It could not be removed surgically, so once again he had to do chemo and radiation.  His lung has begun to re-inflate on its own and things seem to be feel nicely.  However my biggest fear is that the stress of all the medical bills and of being so deep in debt will have him relapsing.  He is a very strong, but very stubborn person.  It is absolutely killing his pride to have to ask for help, but I am glad he is finally letting me do something.  Sitting back and having to watch and hear the crap he is going through and not being able to do a thing about it almost made me crazy.

For me as much as I want to help this is the hardest part, with the economy as it is I don’t want to take something that another is in need of.  Like asking a local small business for a donation, I feel horrible that is something they can sell for profit to pay bills and put food on their tables.  However I have to ask for your HELP I need to show my brother, that random acts of kindness still exist in this world.  Show him that there are people out there willing to help out another in a desperate situation.  I need support for him and his family in every way; I need to know that I somehow made a difference.

I set a goal of $2,500; any help at this point will be truly a gift from above.  I need to see him smile; I need him to know that things will get better.  So please any help you can provide would be amazing.

I have also set up a benefit to be held on March 10th from 11 to 6 @ 126 Gnau Ave SW Unit A in Massillon Ohio 44646, if you cannot make a monetary contribution, please do whatever you can to pass along this information and spread the word.

*ALL FUNDS will go to Curt and his family.

Please think your hearts and make this a special event for family friend who would do it for you. Time is never on anyone's side so really this is now or never people.

 

Thank you for taking the time to hear my story and for your assistance in spreading this information around.

 I LOVE MY BROTHER with all my heart – Please if you have the ability HELP ME, help him!!

Patricia Griffin

story:
Meet Mwalimu William Karisa ...

Can a High School Foreign Exchange Student Help Change the World?

We believe the answer is yes.  Shortly after he arrived in Davenport, Iowa as a scholarship recipient, 17 year old Mwalimu began to dream about raising money to give his village a water well. The culture shock of coming from Kenya to the USA was great for this young man from humble origin. As he enjoyed all the wonderful things his American host family had to offer, Mwalimu couldn't stop thinking about the women in his village (including his own mother) who walked two miles each way to get water from a dirty, stagnant pond.

"One thing I notice is that Americans have an abundance of clean drinking water.  The same is not true in my country.  We don't have clean water in my own village." Mwalimu in December of 2011

He shared this vision with his host family, his local exchange program coordinator and a pastor originally from Kenya.  This core team, along with students at Davenport West High School and exchange students from all over the world, committed to making Mwalimu's Dream come true. Speaking engagements and media events were arranged for him. Mwalimu even wrote a children's book entitled Mwalimu's Dream which was illustrated by another exchange student, Arina Russkikh from Russia. The book was published and proceeds were used to make this dream of a water well come true.

By the time he went home the money was raised to dig the well. He left America in mid-June and by the end of June the well was dug. The water was deep and they dug for days hitting water on Mwalimu's birthday. In the next few weeks the last of the money was raised back in the Quad Cities to buy solar panels, a pump, water tank and platform. Today the project is complete and Mwalimu's mother, and the other women in the village, no longer have to walk for water.  Already Mwalimu's dream is saving lives!

Most people would be this happy if they struck gold; but millions on this planet are filled with joy to have clean, safe drinking water. Thank you Mwalimu for giving us the gift of helping your people!

Mwalimu writes: "I know that more than one billion people on the planet do not have clean, safe drinking water. Even after my village gets a well, my dream continues for others who have this same need."

    Like us on Facebook Mwalimu's Dream 

How did Mwalimu end up in Iowa?

Because of his academic success, interview skills and English speaking ability, young Mwalimu William Karisa earned a scholarship through the Kennedy-Lugar Youth Exchange & Study (YES) program. 

Kennedy-Lugar YES Abroad Program

So this is how Mwalimu happened to become an exchange student at Davenport West High School during the school year 2011-12.  He enjoyed school and his extra-curricular activities were cross country track and youth group.  No doubt his greatest accomplishment was raising the money for the water well for his village. As he got on the airplane to go home to Africa, Mwalimu left knowing dreams really do come true! 

Today Mwalimu's Dream (Phase II) continues in an effort to raise money for wells in Niger ...

Mwalimu's Dream is partnering with Wells4Wellness of Moline, Illinois and Relief Network Ministries, Inc. of League City, Texas.

 

This is a humanitarian work that knows the importance of safe, clean drinking water. Wells4Wellness has worked successfully with Operation Blessing in both Cambodia and in Africa.

Currently Wells4Wellness is working with Relief Network Ministries in Texas targeting the country of Niger. The horrifying statistics in that country are:

  • 16,500,000 people in Niger
  • Average life expectancy is 53 years
  • Average income per year is $700.00
  • 6% of the population has electricity
  • 1 in 3 children go to school
  • Every 20 seconds a child dies from unclean water.   

Meet Pat Herath ... 

Pat Herath is the Director of Wells4Wellness. She is excited every time the funds are raised to dig a well (average cost in Niger is $2,500). However, she has been saddened that the big rigs working to dig wells cannot go to the remote areas of Niger. So this is what this fundraiser is all about! 

We are raising the money needed to buy a small rig that can be taken to these areas where children are dying every day. There are no roads going into many of these places.

For this reason Pat knows she must partner with someone who was raised in the area and can work with locals to make this dream come true. She has found that partner in Relief Network Ministries, Inc.

Visit Wells4Wellness for more information on Pat's work.

 

This Christian organization provides access to clean domestic water, hygiene training and medical aid to the poor, widows and orphans in Third World Countries.

Their vision is to provide charitable services with love and passion that changes the desperate circumstances. They use sustainable funding sources and green technology working with such organizations as Living-Water, Sierra-Leone Relief, Mercy Ships, Shekina-Charities, World Vision, H2O Project, LifeWater and Samaritan's Purse.

Funds are raised each year to help drill new deep and shallow wells, renovate aging equipment, conduct medical missions, ship donated supplies or equipment and train new Rig operators.

Their motto is "Clean water changes everything - disease or health, illiteracy or education for kids, bondage or freedom for women, economic burden or Relief to thrive - Clean water is everything!"

Meet Sunny Okorie ...

A. Sunny Okorie, PhD is President of this organization.  Dr. Okorie was formerly an IT Project Manager and Senior Analyst at Shell Oil Company in Houston Texas where he delivered many successful global & regional projects. Before joining Shell, Dr. Okorie was a Knowledge Mgt Consultant with Inference Corp. and served over a dozen fortune 500 companies in the USA.  He was also on the faculty as a tenured Associate Professor at the Federal University of Technology Owerri, Nigeria (1984-1997).  Dr. Okorie is originally from Nigeria.

Visit Relief Network Ministries for more information on Sunny's work.

                          

With your help, this collaborative effort will reach those hard to reach places or "hot spots" in Niger.

We are working toward a goal to raise funds to buy a small rig. One that can travel to off road sites unsafe for the larger organizations to travel to. The effort to reach the small villages considered hot spots in Niger will be led by A. Sunny Okorie, PhD of Relief Network Ministries. He is originally from Nigeria and knows this area well. He will hire local people which will help him succeed in this effort.

The cost for this rig and this effort will be approximately $60,000.

            

Once we have this rig, the wells themselves cost $2,500 to dig so all monies raised above the goal will go toward digging the wells in these extremely remote places.

 "The lack of safe drinking water in Africa causes many severe problems including dehydration, starvation and disease.  Many children die mainly due to waterborne diseases.  The water shortage means many women and children spend up to one third of their day fetching water.  My own mother experienced this every day of her life until we got our well.  I know it's no small task in rural areas to collect the water which is often polluted and dirty."  Mwalimu William Karisa

 

      Books written by children for children

Learn more about our Holocaust & Human Rights Series at abookbyme.com

 

Meet Deb Bowen ...

Deb is the creator of A BOOK by ME working with young authors and illustrators from the USA and all around the world.  In addition, she works part time with foreign exchange students from Third World countries through the YES program.

"I hope this campaign inspires you to be part of Mwalimu's Dream team giving clean water to the children of the world.  Your gift, large or small, is very much appreciated.  Thank you so much!"   Deb Bowen

P.S. Some people can’t contribute but everyone can help!

  • Take this to your place of worship asking if a love offering can be taken.
  • See if there is a service club in your city who would donate.
  • Ask someone you love to give a gift to this outreach as your Christmas gift
  • Have a fund raiser giving the proceeds to this effort.
  • Post this on your Facebook or Twitter accounts.
  • The ideas are endless so let us know what you are thinking!

Note: Relief Network Ministries is a 501(c) 3 non-profit organization.  Your gifts are tax deductible.

story:
Our Story                                                                                    

             Where do I start? I’m sure you have heard it all and seen it all- people writing letters and taking videos about what is happening with their lives; their pains and sorrows, heartaches and problems that have halted their lives.   Out of desperation and not knowing where to turn, we decided to start a fund raising in order to bring hope and light again in our lives, and maybe , just maybe, a smile that willdominate into a lifetime of hope.  I am one of those people who is looking for that smile for my sister.  She was diagnosed with Lyme disease 6 years ago and not knowing she has had it, has made our lives for the past 3 years the hardest imaginable.  Along with the Lyme disease, she has environmental illness which has turned our lives upside down. Environmental illness is difficult to live with.  Individuals who have this are hypersensitive and some like my sister are affected by electricity, magnetic fields, low and high frequencies. This means she can’t be around any chemical smells (perfume, soaps, etc...), anything that works on electricity, electrical wires, transformers, cell phones, computers, motors of any kind and so on. You can imagine how difficult it has been for us.  Apart from that, she is also light sensitive and has been living in the dark for the past 2 ½ years

            We live in the Laurentians, north of Montreal, Canada.  In 2009, from the month of August up until November, we lived in the dark with no electricity to accommodate my sister’s needs.  The doctors said she needed to be away from the elements that make her ill.  That is why we took her in, my husband and I and our two young children of 8 and 4 and a half years of age.  It was very difficult; our children sacrificed so much for their aunt.  We used hot bottles to warm up when autumn came along. Using heaters was out of the question in order to help my sister.  Winter was soon on its way and out of desperation, I contacted her doctor and she said that some people isolated themselves to keep away from the elements that are keeping them sick.

            We then built an 8x12 trailer in the hopes that it could be used to transport her to where she could be safe and bring her to her doctor.  Unfortunately, because we needed to build it a specific way using inert materials that her sensitivities could handle, the trailer ended up weighing too much and wasn’t safe to move.  She lived in the trailer for about 2 years, electricity free, with no bathroom.  She did her waste in glass jars that we emptied daily.  She is connected to our home to heat her trailer through a water heating system.

            Her needs are getting too much for me and my family to handle.  We needed help to build her a safe home but no one had the heart to support us.  My parents took a 125 000.00 mortgage to help her and we are now 50 000.00 in debt because of the special materials that were needed; we went way over budget.  We don’t have the money to pay it and the interest keeps increasing. She lived in her atelier (workshop) next to her house for about 8 months.  She was hospitalized at Notre Dame Hospital in late October 2012, but the doctors didn’t know how to help her.  They have been tossing her from hospital to hospital - three hospitals in four months; as one doctor put it, she is the patient no doctor wants.  We would want to take her to the Environmental Health Centre in Dallas run by Doctor William Rhea who can help her.  However, it is in the US and the province where we live does not recognize my sister’s illness and will not pay for treatments.  Her doctor told us that it can costs up to 10 thousand a week to treat her.  That’s money we don’t have.  Our parents just took out a mortgage to help build her home (which is too new for her to live in), but the off gassing of the materials used are affecting her sensitivities so she cannot live there for much longer. We have run out of time and money to help her.  Her treatments are costly and the government won’t help people in her situation.  I’ve been using my children’s monthly support allowance and I’ve used up all my savings.  We are literally at the end of our rope and holding on but the pressure is getting to me and I’m being torn between my children, husband and sister.  I am only one person and I can only do so much. We are trying to change Quebec’s view on this illness.  I hope you can find it in your heart to help in any way possible so we can help my sister today and others in the future.

Attached is a link to a letter Giovanna wrote in 2012 about her illness. Please check it out:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XdACb6IC7blJK0qQl7QIUyFZ5Oi-R8GntMZXC3AUAto/edit?usp=sharing

Attached below is a link of pictures of where Giovanna currently lives:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SUKO7lXkZ52NRYiTmqX9fEDST6bRY7ifDNyFkYZNYJ4/edit?usp=sharing

 Thank you

The Guagliardo and Vaccarella Families

 

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $130,000. Before Giovanna can go to Texas, she needs to go to another specialized Doctor for strengthening treatments. This can last anywhere from 1 to 2 months. These treatments cost at least $10,000. Giovanna needs a caretaker as well and a place to stay, food, and personal hygiene products. These funds would keep her there for at least 4 months, where she can hopefully overcome her illness. Any contribution would be greatly appreciated! If we do exceed our goal, the rest of the money will be put into a Lyme Disease Foundation for other people going through the same thing as my aunt, and will also be put towards a website for spreading the knowledge and people’s stories on Lyme disease. Her birthday is March 15th. Let’s make this a memorable birthday for her by raising enough money to help!

The Impact

Lyme disease is a relatively new diagnosis in the medical field, even though it has been around for quite some time. Many people are being misdiagnosed, like my aunt, and when they are correctly diagnosed, it is sometimes too late. I don’t want my aunt to be one of those people. I want to raise awareness for Lyme disease, and let people know that it truly does exist, and it does ruin a person’s life. Not only will this help my aunt in overcoming this illness, it will also help raise awareness of this horrible disease and hopefully help others in the process.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution can help! A dollar per person can make a huge difference! Any amount is welcome and  please share this link with your friends, be it by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.
story_txt:
Our Story                                                                                    
             Where do I start? I’m sure you have heard it all and seen it all- people writing letters and taking videos about what is happening with their lives; their pains and sorrows, heartaches and problems that have halted their lives.   Out of desperation and not knowing where to turn, we decided to start a fund raising in order to bring hope and light again in our lives, and maybe , just maybe, a smile that willdominate into a lifetime of hope.  I am one of those people who is looking for that smile for my sister.  She was diagnosed with Lyme disease 6 years ago and not knowing she has had it, has made our lives for the past 3 years the hardest imaginable.  Along with the Lyme disease, she has environmental illness which has turned our lives upside down. Environmental illness is difficult to live with.  Individuals who have this are hypersensitive and some like my sister are affected by electricity, magnetic fields, low and high frequencies. This means she can’t be around any chemical smells (perfume, soaps, etc...), anything that works on electricity, electrical wires, transformers, cell phones, computers, motors of any kind and so on. You can imagine how difficult it has been for us.  Apart from that, she is also light sensitive and has been living in the dark for the past 2 ½ years
            We live in the Laurentians, north of Montreal, Canada.  In 2009, from the month of August up until November, we lived in the dark with no electricity to accommodate my sister’s needs.  The doctors said she needed to be away from the elements that make her ill.  That is why we took her in, my husband and I and our two young children of 8 and 4 and a half years of age.  It was very difficult; our children sacrificed so much for their aunt.  We used hot bottles to warm up when autumn came along. Using heaters was out of the question in order to help my sister.  Winter was soon on its way and out of desperation, I contacted her doctor and she said that some people isolated themselves to keep away from the elements that are keeping them sick.
            We then built an 8x12 trailer in the hopes that it could be used to transport her to where she could be safe and bring her to her doctor.  Unfortunately, because we needed to build it a specific way using inert materials that her sensitivities could handle, the trailer ended up weighing too much and wasn’t safe to move.  She lived in the trailer for about 2 years, electricity free, with no bathroom.  She did her waste in glass jars that we emptied daily.  She is connected to our home to heat her trailer through a water heating system.

We have run out of time and money to help her.  Her treatments are costly and the government won’t help people in her situation.  I’ve been using my children’s monthly support allowance and I’ve used up all my savings.  We are literally at the end of our rope and holding on but the pressure is getting to me and I’m being torn between my children, husband and sister.  I am only one person and I can only do so much. We are trying to change Quebec’s view on this illness.  I hope you can find it in your heart to help in any way possible so we can help my sister today and others in the future.
Attached is a link to a letter Giovanna wrote in 2012 about her illness. Please check it out:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XdACb6IC7blJK0qQl7QIUyFZ5Oi-R8GntMZXC3AUAto/edit?usp=sharing
Attached below is a link of pictures of where Giovanna currently lives:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SUKO7lXkZ52NRYiTmqX9fEDST6bRY7ifDNyFkYZNYJ4/edit?usp=sharing
 Thank you
The Guagliardo and Vaccarella Families

Our goal is to raise $130,000. Before Giovanna can go to Texas, she needs to go to another specialized Doctor for strengthening treatments. This can last anywhere from 1 to 2 months. These treatments cost at least $10,000. Giovanna needs a caretaker as well and a place to stay, food, and personal hygiene products. These funds would keep her there for at least 4 months, where she can hopefully overcome her illness. Any contribution would be greatly appreciated! If we do exceed our goal, the rest of the money will be put into a Lyme Disease Foundation for other people going through the same thing as my aunt, and will also be put towards a website for spreading the knowledge and people’s stories on Lyme disease. story:
The Mane Attraction

The Hair Dame will answer all of your mane questions and concerns in addition to sharing the latest hair tips and trends. Using Amalia Moscoso's experience and  travels as our guide and inspiration, we will bring you easy to manage hairstyles that you can acheive yourself. The Hair Dame is represented by Amalia and her panel of  professionals in the beauty industry, who are here to share their talents and skills to teach you how to be your very own expert when it comes to your hair.
With your help, we can build our blog that will un-lock the doors to behind-the-scenes, giving you an all access pass to the trade secrets of the tastemakers and trendsetters of the beauty industry. Our stylists will open the lines of communication to viewers via The Hair Dame TV how-to-videos, Q&A opportunities connecting the consumer to the professionals and offer backstage experiences usually only accessible to industry insiders. 
 
By making a monetary contribution you are also contributing to female empowerment. Our goal is to give ladies the tools and inspiration to be creative and confident when it comes to not only looking but feeling their absolute best. 

Cutting to the Point

Our goal is to raise enough funds to shoot, edit and produce our initial fifteen videos for The Hair Dame TV and build out a comprehensive, interactive website. We are also raising capital to cover initial start-up costs including trademarks, public relations, marketing and brand development. 

The Red Carpet Look

Celebrities and other beauty icons have teams behind them that carefully consider and craft their styles. The Hair Dame wishes to deliver this same luxury to it's readers by exposing and educating them to the same tricks and tools of the trade by those who created them.
 
Word of Mouth
Another way that you can contribute is to tell your friends about us-The Hair Dame is all about connecting socially and we'd love to make your friends our friends! Tweet us your beauty questions and blunders at @thehairdame or contact us on www.thehairdame.com anytime!
 
We appreciate your support - It takes a team to build a dream!
 
Thank you from our hearts.

story:
Official Website Available NOW

                                      OR CLICK THE PICTURE ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓

 

Read this page in a different language:

日本語    Español    русский    Português    Français   中文

In the media

Video via Mashable:

 

 

How do you use it?

Simply put the mask on and your selected light and sound program begins. If you take the mask off, your program pauses. 

A More Comfortable Mask


Dreamlight’s top priority is helping you get better sleep, and making the Dreamlight as comfortable as possible is the core of this – that’s why it looks different from other sleep masks. 

Most masks place pressure on the sensitive eyes and cheeks. Instead, Dreamlight's design moves the pressure away from sensitive facial areas. 

The Dreamlight’s unique wraparound design minimizes pressure on sleep-affecting areas of the face, while remaining in place. 

By distributing pressure around the back of the head and padding the nose area, Dreamlight sits comfortably on users.

Light-led Breathing

Studies show that deep breathing elicits a feeling of relaxation, according to an article carried by Harvard Medical School. Dreamlight uses this to ease you into sleep. 

By breathing along with the soothing glow of Dreamlight's internal orange light, you'll enter sleep quickly and rest better.

Try one of Dreamlight's breathing programs below.

Sleep Monitoring

Dreamlight’s heart-rate monitor and gyroscope are used to create a uniquely robust sleep profile, which is displayed in Dreamlight’s cross-platform app. 
By looking at your vital signs combined with levels of movement, Dreamlight provides personal insight to help you get the best rest possible.

The Dreamlight App

Sounds of Nature

Sound and sleep seem like odd bedfellows – but finding the right noises for when your sleeping can help you rest better than ever before. 

That’s where Dreamlight’s four internal headphones come in. Via Dreamlight’s app, you can create custom soundscapes.

  • Nature sounds (the sound of rain, for example) were shown to reduce stress and lower heart rates in a 2017 article published by Scientific Reports.
  • White noise contains a wide frequency of sounds, helping mask environmental noise like loud neighbors or traffic. 
  • Light music has been scientifically shown to ready the body for sleep and improve quality of sleep.
  • Binaural beats, or brainwave entertainment, are steady beats played at specific frequencies. Some report entering a peaceful state when listening to binaural beats. 
  • ASMR, or autonomous sensory meridian response, is a sound-induced tingling feeling that many find relaxing. The Dreamlight app contains dozens of ASMR stimulating options.

We understand everyone is different. By using the sliders inside of our app, you can create a combination of sounds that specifically work for you.

After rigorous testing, we have inserted four premium sounding speakers,  invisibly embedded inside the Dreamlight mask. This decision was made so that the speakers can be used at full quality, regardless of head size or ear positioning. Binaural audio gives the surround-sound effect of being present in a relaxing and natural environment, rhythmically drifting to sleep to the patter of light rainfall, laying in the quiet echo of a forest, or resting by a summer brook.

Waking Up

Millions of people start their day to the scream of an alarm clock: an unpleasant experience that studies suggest may be linked with weight-gain and even heart problems.
Dreamlight avoids audio alarms by using internal lights to slowly wake you. The lights within the mask slowly begin to brighten near a set wake time,  so users wake slowly and begin the day relaxed.

Infrared Beauty Treatment

Dreamlight’s infrared light treatment boosts blood circulation around the eyes while you sleep, improving the skin’s appearance and health.

Infrared light is already a widely-used beauty treatment, which may also heal skin damage, according to a 2014 study carried by the US National Library of Medicine.

Getting Ahead of Jet Lag

There’s no easy way around jet lag. But Dreamlight can help.
By entering the date and time of your next flight, Dreamlight’s cross-platform app creates a personalized sleep schedule that slowly adjusts you to your future time zone.

Paired with Dreamlight’s circadian rhythm regulating green lights, the Dreamlight mask will minimize jet lag by getting you on the right schedule ahead of time.

DNA-based Advice

Sleep and genetics are closely linked, with a 2011 Stanford University study finding “It is now clear that sleep is genetically controlled.”

By looking at your DNA we can recommend the best sleep schedule for you through the Dreamlight app, and transfer that sleep schedule into the mask.

The Dreamlight DNA perk will see your DNA tested so we can provide you with custom advice to help develop your best sleep schedule. 

It’s as easy as sending a swab to trusted genetic companies like 23andMe, which has mapped the genetics of more than two million people from saliva samples sent through the mail. 

Cleanable

The back panel of the Dreamlight mask is detachable, allowing for easy cleaning.

Timeline

Spread the Word

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q: Will the orange light be on through the whole night?
A: No, users choose the light therapy duration via Dreamlight's front controls or inside the Dreamlight app. 
Q: Will the infrared light be on through the night?
A: No, users can set up the infrared facial treatment via Dreamlight's front panel, or inside the Dreamlight app. The infrared facial duration and intensity can be adjusted according to personal preference.
Q: Will the music be on through the night?
A:  It depends on the users’ preferences. The Dreamlight app has a sleep timer or can be set to replay music. 
Q: Is it travel-friendly?
A: Yes, the Dreamlight will include a travel pouch. Dreamlight is also made of flexible material, which can fold up while traveling. 
Q: How long does the battery last?
A: About 14 days when used for light therapy. About seven days, when used to play audio for 30 minutes daily. For one year on standby.  
Q: Will Dreamlight support future upgrades?
A: Yes, the Dreamlight can be upgraded with the Dreamlight app. 
Q: Should I open my eyes or close my eyes during light therapy?
A: Both are fine and it depends on the user’s preference. 
Q: What if the lighting is too strong/weak for me? Can I adjust it?
A: Yes, users can adjust the intensity of lighting in the Dreamlight app.

For any other questions, please email us at Will@Dreamlight.tech.

We're Ready for Mass Production

Working from our fabrication lab allowed us to implement rapid, incremental prototyping — testing functionality and performance at every step. 

This included button-life testing, ensuring the front panel is long lasting. 

We also tested the product in temperature-humidity containers and thermal shock chambers, ensuring that the Dreamlight mask is being built to the highest quality.

Dreamlight received an incredible reception at CES by the president and CEO of CES, Gary Shapiro (pictured).

Risks & Challenges

An experienced team developed Dreamlight, and will continue working on the project. We’re no strangers to manufacturing in China and the challenges involved. 
While we recognize unforeseen events may pose a challenge, we have a proven record of creating products from design to sale. 
We have multiple working models and received a favorable review from The Verge, but we need more time and funding to produce Dreamlight at scale. Once we hit our goal, manufacturing and delivery should face minimum challenges.
Shipment can at times be tricky: issues can arise with too much demand, delaying delivery. Border customs can also cause issues, possibly resulting in a few days delay. We will be transparent and provide updates if such issues arise.

story:
Who Are We? 

Founded in 1936, Quinebarge is a coed, traditional camp located on 65 acres of forest and 1,250 feet of pristine Lake Kanasatka in Moultonborough, New Hampshire, owned by non-profit environmental organization Carbonfund.org Foundation. We offer a variety of activities for 100 great kids aged 7-15. 

Quinebarge encourages campers to challenge themselves and to try new activities in a safe and supportive setting with staff helping each child grow, learn, and achieve their goals. We foster a spirit of community, cooperation and respect for nature embedded into our rich tradition of camp life that includes outdoor activities, campfires, songs and skits, and cabin living. Campers develop memories and friendships that will last a lifetime.

Where Do the Funds Go?

Each summer, in addition to giving financial assistance to lower-income families, we host a number of underprivileged youth from the inner city. Many of these children have never experienced the outdoors the way they can at camp. These campers are able to challenge themselves and experience new things, while adding diversity to our camp community. 

As a non-profit, our goal is to cover our costs while providing an amazing camp experience. Just $350 can send a child to Quinebarge for one week. Our aim is to raise at least $7,500 to fund our scholarships, all of which will go towards sending up to 10 children to camp. And because we are a 501(c)3 non-profit, your donation is tax deductible. 

Why Is This Important?

Spending a summer at Quinebarge can have a huge impact on the lives of all our campers, but especially those who attend on scholarship. Campers grow and develop skills and friendships that last a lifetime. Our program: 

  • Builds confidence
  • Promotes understanding of and respect for the natural world
  • Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities
  • Gives kids a chance to be kids
  • Health benefits of being in an active natural environment

How Else Can I Help?

Even if you can't make a monetary donation, any help you can give makes a difference in the lives of our campers. Please spread the word or refer a camper, so we can continue this wonderful program! 

For more information, please visit www.campquinebarge.com, or email our Director Liz at fun@campquinebarge.com

Thank you for your support!

Campers develop memories and friendships that will last a lifetime.Where Do the Funds Go?Each summer, in addition to giving financial assistance to lower-income families, we host a number of underprivileged youth from the inner city. Many of these children have never experienced the outdoors the way they can at camp. These campers are able to challenge themselves and experience new things, while adding diversity to our camp community. As a non-profit, our goal is to cover our costs while providing an amazing camp experience. Just $350 can send a child to Quinebarge for one week. Our aim is to raise at least $7,500 to fund our scholarships, all of which will go towards sending up to 10 children to camp. And because we are a 501(c)3 non-profit, your donation is tax deductible. Why Is This Important?Spending a summer at Quinebarge can have a huge impact on the lives of all our campers, but especially those who attend on scholarship. Campers grow and develop skills and friendships that last a lifetime. Our program: 
Builds confidence
Promotes understanding of and respect for the natural world
Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities
Gives kids a chance to be kids
Health benefits of being in an active natural environment
How Else Can I Help?Even if you can't make a monetary donation, any help you can give makes a difference in the lives of our campers. Please spread the word or refer a camper, so we can continue this wonderful program! For more information, please visit www.campquinebarge.com, or email our Director Liz at fun@campquinebarge.comThank you for your support!

story: Jam Kancer In The Kan is a Kan Jam tournament that was established to generate money for Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in NYC.  In an effort to raise money for this wonderful cause we have asked 24 couples to come out for a competitive game of Kan Jam where we will crown the top Kan Jam couple in Scotch Plains.  All donations and sponsorship money will be donated directly to Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.  Everyone is effected by this deadly disease and your money can help rid the world of this disease.  Thank you for your support!

story:
SPINCAST = GO!


  • Jan 13/15: Happy New Year! Well, it's taking a little longer than expected to edit the first six Spincast workouts, but we're in the homestretch. Scot is uploading the near final cuts and we should have your download links to you in a matter of days. In the meantime, thank you for your patience and don't hesitate to contact us: spincasts@gmail.com. 




  • Oct 31/14: You did it! Thanks to our backers and sponsors we're editing hard to deliver Spincast Season 1 nowish. If you missed out on the campaign, you can still get you winter workouts by emailing: spincasts@gmail.com.


  • Sept 30/14: Thanks to everyone who joined us and backed us at the Campaign Launch Ride Sept 30. And thanks to host/roaster 81301 Coffee and to Guayaki for the clean, powerful ingestibles. If you missed the kick off ride, chin up, your winter workouts are just a few clicks away--->



Let's Ride

For those times when you can't train at altitude in Durango, Colorado with your favorite elite cyclist/coaches, we created Spincast. A series of bike, core, yoga workouts designed to get you fit for life, even if you're stuck in NYC, San Francisco, Tokyo, or Paris.

  • Spincast downloadable video workouts feature expert instruction and cattle prodding (where necessary) by national champ, Marisa Asplund, and MTB pro, Nick Gould.
  • Season1 is "in the can" and all it needs is some pro editing before we can put it in your hands. With your help, we can deliver these great workouts and more right to the screen and water-resistant earbuds of your choice.
  • Without your help, Spincast quality fitness instruction will remain cloistered high in the Rocky Mountains, available to only the lucky few who can get to Marisa's or Nick's workouts before ass o'clock when all the bikes are taken.

So to recap, we've professionally videoed six rad, mad, sick, super, awesome, really very good workouts and now we need the money to get them well-edited so you can have them and love them and change your life with them.


Meet Your Re-makers

   

Marisa Asplund has been a competitive athlete at the elite level since 2004. Most of her career has been as a professional road cyclist but she also holds pro/elite status in triathlon and duathlon, and continues to dominate at long distance running events. In 2010 she took the gold at the US National Duathlon Championship. Marisa continues to be a fierce competitor and, although she loves the training and the pure grit of difficult events, she finds most enjoyment in living a healthy balanced lifestyle that incorporates fitness, nutrition, and mental health. Her passion for helping others continues as a certified coach and registered psychotherapist. 

  

Nick Gould has been racing and riding mountain bikes since he was 15. He moved to Durango from Maine to attend Fort Lewis College and to race. After graduating from college, Nick turned pro and has been competing internationally ever since. Nick’s yoga path began in 2010 when he decided to take his personal training and professional mountain biking to a new level. Now he uses yoga as a tool to aid in recovery from racing and to keep his mind, body, and soul balanced. Nick’s musical alter ego, dj Niko, performs all over the world. 


What We Need + What You Get

We've been asked to "break it down" for the people, so: 

  • With $6,000 dollars we can fast track editing of Spincast season1 and get all six workouts to you in time for fall, winter, and spring training.
  • We've put together some perks we think you'll crave and if you don't we'll create some more. Email us with your likes, dislikes, and such: spincasts@gmail.com.
  • When it's clear that we're reaching our spot-on $6,000 goal, we'll get our editors rolling so you don't have to wait forever for the best workouts this side of your quadriceps femoris.


The Impact

The impact? How about a happier, healthier population, starting with you? Plus, why suffer on your next ride when you can make the next guy do it? Seriously, let's just get busy getting fit. It will be good.

With Spincast season1, you get six workouts you can mix-and-match to achieve at, near, or beyond the fitness results you are currently obsessing about. Kind of up to you, of course, but let us help. A suggested regimen to start:

  • Monday: Marisa Spin 
  • Tuesday: Nick Spin + Marisa Core
  • Wednesday: Marisa Core + Nick Yoga
  • Thursday: Marisa Spin + Nick Yoga
  • Friday: Nick Spin
  • Saturday: sit quietly (you can also eat something and go dancing) 
  • Sunday: go outside 
Marisa and Nick have helped thousands of people get and stay fit. But that doesn't really matter if Spincasts don't work for you. So we created the Spincast guarantee: if Spincast is not to your satisfaction, we'll refund your contribution to our project, apologize, and hit a punishing and penitent set of hill repeats.


Risks + Challenges

Risks: if we don't make this happen, fitness gods be mad.

Challenges: no challenges, just "opportunities." Mainly opportunities to ride and rejoice in good health for a very, very long time. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Wish you could help, but you just bought a bike that cost more than your car? We understand. But that doesn't mean you can't pitch in in your own massive way:

  • Make some noise about our project on your favorite social media sites. Indiegogo share tools make it easy.

Thanks for reading. We hope you'll get in on Spincast with us. Now, let's ride >

story:
Raw Potential is the cost effective way to gain instant visual feedback of your exercise form and technique, giving you a better understanding of your fitness strengths and weaknesses; giving you the confidence and motivation to safely and successfully achieve your goals.



Stepping into the weights room for the first time can be an intimidating experience; even if you regularly play sport, knowing what exercises to do and how to do them can be overwhelming and something you may have avoiding in the past.  But we all have to start somewhere, and there are big benefits if you do.

Whether at home, in the gym, or on the pitch, the Raw Potential App allows you to photograph your present technique and then compare and correct this technique in real time, against the correct technique of the ‘fitness avatar’. This allows you to train with confidence and conviction, know that if you get your technique right from the beginning, you will see the results.


Whether as a result of injury, a-symmetrical sports, or previous incorrect exercise technique – imbalances in muscle strength and flexibility can cause a change in our movement patterns and posture.  If you have trained in a certain way for a long time, you may not been aware of potentially hazardous muscle imbalances you may have, which could be effecting your performance

Just like the body learns over time to compensate for a weakness, it can re-learn to move in a safe and balanced way.  The Raw Potential mobile app provides a visual reference to assess whether your technique is balanced or not.  The sooner you identify an imbalance, the sooner you can do take action, and the quicker the problem will be to resolve.  By correcting muscular imbalances, you reduce your risk of further or future injury.


There is no limit to the amount of information available offering different fitness and exercise plans and techniques – but how do you know which is right for you?  To answer this, first you must know your personal strengths and weaknesses, and how these are affecting your performance in either a positive or negative way.


We’re all individuals – so need an exercise plan relevant to our own problems areas and goals.  The Raw Potential mobile app allows you to identify and understand errors in your technique; enabling you to then use the app to design a program of specific exercises to overcome any weaknesses, and to push yourself further on your strengths.





Liu ‘Victoria’ Batchelor, Raw Potential Inventor;

“Sport has always been massively important to me, the greatest of my achievements being competing for team GB at the European wakeboarding championships.  However this came at a cost, as in 2008 I suffered but recovered from a ruptured MCL knee ligament. Then in 2009 I suffered a twice broken kneecap and ruptured quadriceps tendon.  Despite spending over a year in a knee brace, I was determined not to give up. In 2011 I took up weight training, and now I am a fitness model and figure competition winner.

Recovering from two major knee injuries is the thing in my life that I am most proud of.  It gave me both a new respect for my body, and a greater understanding of how to get the best out of it.  It was through good form and determination that I was able to overcome my injury, and become stronger than I ever thought I could be.

However I have seen so many of my friends and family suffer injury and not make a full recovery, be that both physically and a lack of confidence in their abilities.  The inspiration behind Raw Potential was to create a cheap and easy tool that allows them and others to get a greater understanding of their bodies, allowing them to achieve their full potential.”


 Raw Origins - Training Motivation and Gym Wear

Tumblr blog with 17,000 followers from just 40 posts.  Features motivational and workout advice with a clean cut, no nonsense attitude.  Soon to launch gym  wear.  Visit Raw Origins at www.raworigins-blog.tumblr.com


Sports Injury Community - Website and Events

Website of inspirational and motivational stories and events, to help sports people of all abilities to deal with and overcome sports injuries.  Visit Sports Injury Community at www.sportsinjurycommunity.wordpress.com



Only with your support can we make the Raw Potential Form Check app a reality. 

The app will allow users check their technique for the most popular exercises for free, before downloading additional exercises depending on their individual strengths and weaknesses.  All features of the app will be design to ‘show, not tell’; using strong artistic imagery to allow you to get a better and quicker understanding of where you may be going wrong and what to do about it.  

The app will have both a ‘form check’ mode to analyze exercise technique, and then a ‘workout’ mode to quickly view .gifs of your workout plan – allowing you to spend more time training and less time on your phone!


- App developed first for iOS, then quickly afterwards for Android

- Free to download app and first key exercises

- Download your choice of addition exercises in-app, depending on your strengths and weaknesses

- Dynamic visual .gifs exercise demonstrations both in ‘form check’ or ‘workout’ mode

- Save your exercise screenings and compare at a later date to see improvements

- Supporting advice and videos online

Your contributions will help build the first release of the Raw Potential app available to the public. 

Expert app designers and developers will be bought in to develop an intuitive user interface, while creative photographers and videographers will capture artistic and motivational exercise content. 

A partnership with Loughborough University, the most prestigious center for sports in the UK, will the carry out testing of the app.

- £7,500 – Technical development of the App

- £1,000 – Creative design and development of App user interface

- £500 – Exercise consultation and App testing

- £250 – Photography and filming of all exercises

- £750 – Legalities and administration


With your contribution you will be helping improve not only your own performance, but also helping your friends, team mates and fellow sports men and women to get more out of exercise and sport. 

You will be helping yourself and other gain confidence in themselves and exercise, reduce the fear and chance of injury, and increase the motivation and pride we all feel at achieving our goals and reaching our full potential.

- Help shape the features and design of the app – give us your feedback of product development (ETA: Mid summer 2014)

- Be the first to try the app – get the beta version of the app before anyone else (ETA: Late summer 2014)

- Get free access to paid features – get all available exercises (ETA: Autumn 2014 if full funding received)

- Access more free video advice and motivation training content –get training today (ETA: Now – Ongoing)

- Set the trend – get exclusive ‘first release’ clothing from sister company Raw Origins (ETA – within 1 month of campaign close)

- Be part of the community - Sponsorship opportunities available to brands and professionals

story:
Ben's Story

Ben Frroku is 26 years old and a life-long family friend. Living only a street away from each other, my brothers and I grew up with Ben and went to school with him. We all have many fond memories of our childhood together. In the picture of the two boys above, Ben is on the left and my second brother is on the right. 

My name is Kristjana and I would like to raise money for Ben (above) so that he can afford a costly kidney transplant operation. Ben's family has been crippled financially by medical costs in the past 10 years due to his mother having similar kidney problems. She too requires a kidney transplant but her condition is less grave then Ben's. Last year, however, during Ben's brother's wedding he collapsed and was taken to hospital. There, Ben, just 25 years old at the time, was informed Ben that he was in desperate need of a transplant because both of his kidneys had stopped working. Since then Ben has been travelling 100km to a specialist hospital in the capital Tirana to receive dialysis (a 4 hour process) 3 times a week. He can't do much else but survive on a daily basis. 

Luckily for Ben, his father is a match, therefore, he has a kidney available. However, Ben and his family are unable to overcome the financial barrier of the operation. The privatisation of healthcare and socio-economic situation of many living in Albania means that the price is well beyond his funds. 

Family and friends have helped with affording dialysis, medication and transport for both Ben and his mother but now we are hoping that people can help us raise money for Ben to have his operation and live a normal life. 

What We Need 

Ben's operation costs £12,000.

We have already held a 5-a-side football tournament which was a huge success, but we still need crowd funding to go that extra bit. We will also be endeavouring on a cycle through Europe to reach Ben in Albania. 

If we do not reach our target, we will use a little bit of the money to organise fund-raising events, such as cake sales/runs, to raise more money through other means. If we can achieve our target, Ben will be able to afford the operation and live a normal life. If we can exceed this, Ben can pay off some of the loans that he has taken out in order to afford consultations, medication and other medical care. Similarly, the money can be used to fund healthcare for his mother.  

The Cycle

I have decided to cycle to Ben, who lives in Albania, this summer to raise money for him. I will be starting in London, travelling through 14 cities which will be my check points, until my finish in Skodra, Albania. My aim is to cycle 20-50 miles through each city (depending on location), then be transported a closer distance to the next check point. I will have a support vehicle that will help me through much of the journey, and which will help me in keeping you updated about my progress. 

https://www.facebook.com/KrisLondonAlbaniaCharityBikeRide?ref=hl

 

 Impact 

Albania is still a developing country, overlooked and in the shadow of the major European countries surrounding it. Living in Albania is extremely difficult, work is scarce and expenses run high. This operation will change Ben's life, he will be able to find work, live a normal life and spend time with his family and friends once again. Not only that, but we believe this will help raise awareness of the kidney diseases in Albania and also highlight the desperate need to review of the national health care provisions. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Ben's kidneys are failing, we don't know how long he can keep receiving dialysis. To be blunt, this is a pressing matter. Taking a few minutes to read this page, sharing and donating can change his life forever. 

    It is a challenge that Ben is not British. Healthcare in Albania is extremely expensive and not always available. The central issue to his story is that he is a young man in need. He is shown love, kindness and respect to me my family and I, the least we can do is attempt to give back and help him. 


    Other Ways You Can Help
    Please donate anything, even as little as £1. More importantly, please tell your friends and family about this campaign.

    Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and listening to Ben's cause. 

    With the warmest thanks,
    Kristjana

However, Ben and his family are unable to overcome the financial barrier of the operation. The privatisation of healthcare and socio-economic situation of many living in Albania means that the price is well beyond his funds. Family and friends have helped with affording dialysis, medication and transport for both Ben and his mother but now we are hoping that people can help us raise money for Ben to have his operation and live a normal life.    What We Need Ben's operation costs £12,000.We have already held a 5-a-side football tournament which was a huge success, but we still need crowd funding to go that extra bit. We will also be endeavouring on a cycle through Europe to reach Ben in Albania. If we do not reach our target, we will use a little bit of the money to organise fund-raising events, such as cake sales/runs, to raise more money through other means. If we can achieve our target, Ben will be able to afford the operation and live a normal life. If we can exceed this, Ben can pay off some of the loans that he has taken out in order to afford consultations, medication and other medical care. Similarly, the money can be used to fund healthcare for his mother.  The CycleI have decided to cycle to Ben, who lives in Albania, this summer to raise money for him. I will be starting in London, travelling through 14 cities which will be my check points, until my finish in Skodra, Albania. My aim is to cycle 20-50 miles through each city (depending on location), then be transported a closer distance to the next check point. I will have a support vehicle that will help me through much of the journey, and which will help me in keeping you updated about my progress. https://www.facebook.com/KrisLondonAlbaniaCharityBikeRide?ref=hl
 
 Impact  Albania is still a developing country, overlooked and in the shadow of the major European countries surrounding it. Living in Albania is extremely difficult, work is scarce and expenses run high. This operation will change Ben's life, he will be able to find work, live a normal life and spend time with his family and friends once again. Not only that, but we believe this will help raise awareness of the kidney diseases in Albania and also highlight the desperate need to review of the national health care provisions. 

  
Risks & Challenges
Ben's kidneys are failing, we don't know how long he can keep receiving dialysis. To be blunt, this is a pressing matter. Taking a few minutes to read this page, sharing and donating can change his life forever. 
It is a challenge that Ben is not British. Healthcare in Albania is extremely expensive and not always available. The central issue to his story is that he is a young man in need. He is shown love, kindness and respect to me my family and I, the least we can do is attempt to give back and help him. 

Other Ways You Can HelpPlease donate anything, even as little as £1. More importantly, please tell your friends and family about this campaign.






Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and listening to Ben's cause. 
With the warmest thanks,Kristjana

story:
Sitting for hours is BAD for you.

Check out this Mashable Infographic

Even if you have a relatively active life, sitting for more than 6 hours a day can increase likelihood of early death 40% in women and 20% in men. 

 

What's the most important thing in writing?

BICHOK- Butt In Chair, Hands On Keyboard 

 

So how do we balance these two things? 

 

WELL WRITER

The simple web interface lets you log in, choose the type of exercises you want, set a timer for how long you want to write and then go.

 

Stay focused while you write

Writing against a timer helps keeps you focused. The workout breaks are good for your health, reduce stress, prevent all the aches and pains that come with sitting in the same position for long periods of time.

 

Professional & Accessible

The goal for these workout breaks is to make them as straight forward and simple as possible, without treating you like an idiot. 

I am an ACE certified Personal Trainer & an ACE certified Advanced Health & Fitness Specialist. I have been working in fitness for 10 + years. 

What will the money go toward?

Producing the initial videos for the site (hopefully it will be self sustaining in a short period of time) and building the website. 

 

The Effect

This will provide an inexpensive way to get people moving, improving everyone's health and wellbeing for years to come.
